text: rewrite this essay in the style of Harmonie Korine, Hello all, just a quick note on me and my AI journey. It all began in the fall of 2022 when a friend (shout out to the homey Chris) alerted me to this new magical AI application called Midjourney. It would blow me away he told me, allow me to create my own illustrations of whatever my mind could conjure, in whatever style I could imagine. That one conversation took me down an AI art rabbit hole I have yet to emerge from! Since then I have used AI applications (Kaiber, Moonvalley, Pika, Runway, Play HT, DiD, along with my Adobe Suite and self taught design skills) to create everything from Murals, to Comic Books, 100's of T-Shirt Designs, Music Videos, Flyers, Animated Shorts, Animated Sequences for Documentaries and TV Shows, Graphics, Interstitials, tons of Social Media Content and more. In addition I have taught what I've learned in classes with youth and adults on the Caribbean island of Montserrat and at the University of North Florida. While I've covered wide areas of AI usage in art, video and sound, the one area that I had yet to enter successfully was the utilization of AI to write a script. I had attempted this a year ago when the tech wasn't quite ready and I didn't have a technique. I was writing a spec script on the life of John and Alice Coltrane. I asked AI to write me a scene featuring John and Alice Coltrane having an argument about his drug use in their kitchen. The AI ended up interpreting the "John" in my prompt as "John Travolta" and the "Alice" as "Alice in Wonderland". 5 pages of this junk. While interesting on the face of it, greatly frustrating and time wasting. This is what is called a "hallucination", when an AI model generates incorrect information but presents it as if it were a fact. Being as how I was writing a historical script, facts were invaluable to the process. So needless to say, I abandoned that potential boondoggle. But something was about to change. On a whim one month ago, I decided to apply for a potentially life changing opportunity. It is a grant for Latino writers who had a show concept in the drama genre featuring a Latino lead. 6 people are chosen to receive it and the winners get to pitch their show ideas before professional show runners and a big network. I found about about this with one week left before the application window was closing so I quickly got to work. Luckily I had written an entire Bible (a reference document used by screenwriters for information on characters, settings, and other elements of a film project) for a show idea 3 years ago that genre wise fit this contest well enough. It is called "Electro Is Dead" and without getting too deep into the plot basically, it is "The summer of 1988 in Venice Beach, CA. Dennis Juarez aka DJ Rey, Afro-Chicano teen Electro DJ, becomes enmeshed into a dark plot to bring about Hell on Earth."

text: Social media release for: Public Service Announcement: Unprotected Beaches and Potential Risks The Longport Police Department would like to remind the public about the risks associated with swimming at unprotected beaches. As the official beach patrol season comes to a close, the number of protected beaches within Longport has been reduced for the next few weeks. Swimming at unprotected beaches can be dangerous due to various factors such as unpredictable undertows, rip currents, and lack of immediate assistance in case of an emergency. The absence of trained lifeguards further increases the risks and can potentially lead to life-threatening situations as seen most recently at local beaches along Absecon Island. Therefore, it is strongly advised to avoid swimming at unprotected beaches during the off season, especially as we are now in the hurricane season. Longport PD remains committed to safeguarding the community and reminds all residents and visitors to prioritize their safety by making informed decisions regarding beach activities. It is essential to be vigilant, follow safety guidelines, and be aware of any updates or changes provided by local authorities. For additional information, updates, and safety tips, please follow our official Longport Police Department social media channels (Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter) or visit our website. Stay safe and enjoy the start to our fall season responsibly!

text: explain what this script does: import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import random class uHaul: def __init__(self, username, password, entity='', debugMode=False, proxy=""): self.username = username self.password = password self.debugMode = debugMode self.authenticated = False self.proxies=dict(http=proxy,https=proxy) self.entity = entity self.sessionSecret = '' self.session = self.createSession() self.authenticate() def dprint(self, msg): if(self.debugMode): print("[debug] ---> " + str(msg)) def createSession(self): session = requests.Session() self.dprint("Init requests session...") session.headers.update({ 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/117.0' }) session.proxies.update(self.proxies) return session def authenticate(self): postData = {'Username':self.username, 'Password':self.password, 'Entity':self.entity } req = self.session.post("https://pos.uhaul.net/secure/CSFRewriteConsole2/Account/Login",data=postData) ## need to change success key if ('<title>Reservation Details</title>' in req.text): self.authenticated = True self.sessionSecret = req.history[1].headers['Location'].split("/")[3] # secret0 = req.history[0].url self.dprint("Authenticated! ") self.dprint("Sessuib secret = " + str(self.sessionSecret)) else: self.dprint("Failed to authenticate") def searchForCustomer(self,customer): secretsessionid = self.sessionSecret url = f"https://pos.uhaul.net/secure/CSFRewriteConsole2/{secretsessionid}/Customer/SearchForCustomer" postData = { 'searchItem': customer } req = self.session.post(url,data=postData) self.dprint(req.text) result = json.loads(req.text) self.dprint("[" + str(result['success']) + f"] ---- customer lookup status for [{customer}]") uhaul_username = "kj046613" uhaul_password = "Beltline@1221" mainaccount = uHaul(uhaul_username, uhaul_password, debugMode=True, proxy="socks5://67.213.212.58:20010") mainaccount.searchForCustomer("test@uhaul.com") print(uHaul.get_proxy())

text: ChatGPT is a chatbot from OpenAI that has recently taken the world by storm, and there's a new app that lets you access it on a Mac. Here's how to get started. OpenAI launched ChatGPT in November, built on the company's GPT-3 machine learning models. Companies such as Microsoft have integrated it while others — including Google — fear it. It has various applications to answer questions and generate text, and a new app has appeared that brings it to the Mac menu bar. Created by Jordi Bruin, MacGPT is a macOS app available for free, though people can add their own price to help support the developer. Once a user logs in with their OpenAI credentials, they can click the menu bar icon to start a conversation. It's also possible to assign it a keyboard shortcut to activate MacGPT without needing a mouse or trackpad.

In other instances, this figure traveled through time with the very same time machine featured in H.G. Wells' story "The Time Machine", or perhaps traveled alongside Ebenezer Scrooge. This author even wrote stories where his character and Sherlock Holmes involved in the affairs of the Jane Austen novel "Pride and Prejudice" and did battles with Mr. Hyde or encountering Frankenstein’s monster from Mary Shelly's "Frankenstein" and Count Dracula, Stoker’s own creation. Instead of being standalone stories, an unknown author had thought to mix his own original ideas with the works of others.

text: write in Markdown Code:# Investment Research Report ## Introduction China's domestic market for electric vehicles (EVs) has grown rapidly in recent years. With the increasing demand and government support, EV manufacturers have been expanding their portfolios and developing innovative technologies to compete in this emerging market. In this report, we will analyze two leading EV manufacturers in China, Li Auto and XPeng, and present a long-short investment strategy based on our fundamental analysis. ## Executive Summary - We recommend a long position in Li Auto and a short position in XPeng. - Li Auto has a higher revenue and margin than XPeng, indicating better operational efficiency and profitability. - Li Auto has a unique extended-range electric vehicle (EREV) technology that gives it a competitive advantage. - Our valuation analysis suggests that Li Auto is undervalued compared to XPeng. - Political and market risks exist in the EV industry in China, but we believe that Li Auto's strong fundamentals and unique technology can help mitigate these risks. - We also consider the ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) factors in our investment strategy, and Li Auto performs better in this aspect. ## Companies Portfolio | Company | Li Auto | XPeng | | --- | --- | --- | | Founded | 2015 | 2014 | | Headquartered | Beijing, China | Guangzhou, China | | Vehicle Models | Li ONE | G3, P7 | | Market Cap (as of 4/25/2023) | USD 41.8 billion | USD 32.6 billion | | Stock Ticker | LI | XPEV | ## Companies' Fundamental Analysis ### Revenue and Margin - Li Auto's revenue for 2022 is estimated to be USD 9.1 billion, while XPeng's revenue is expected to be USD 7.8 billion. - Li Auto's gross margin for 2022 is estimated to be 18.3%, while XPeng's gross margin is estimated to be 14.7%. - Li Auto's net income margin for 2022 is estimated to be 4.1%, while XPeng's net income margin is estimated to be 2.8%. ### Cash Flow and Interest - Li Auto has positive operating and free cash flows, indicating healthy cash flow management. XPeng has negative operating and free cash flows. - Li Auto's debt-to-equity ratio is 0.03, while XPeng's debt-to-equity ratio is 0.15, indicating that Li Auto has a lower debt burden. ### Technologies - Li Auto has a unique EREV technology that combines an electric motor with a small gasoline engine to extend the vehicle's range, providing a competitive advantage in the EV market. - XPeng has advanced autonomous driving technologies, including a self-developed full-stack system, which could potentially give it a competitive edge in the future. ## Valuation Method We used the discounted cash flow (DCF) method to value Li Auto and XPeng. ### Inputs - Discount rate: 10% - Terminal growth rate: 2% - Revenue growth rate (2023-2032): Li Auto 22%, XPeng 25% - Gross margin (2023-2032): Li Auto 18.5%, XPeng 15% - Net income margin (2023-2032): Li Auto 3.5%, XPeng 2.5% - Capital expenditures (2023-2032): Li Auto 10% of revenue, XPeng 12% of revenue - Depreciation and amortization (2023-2032): Li Auto 8% of revenue, XPeng 10% of revenue ### Results - Li Auto's fair value is estimated to be USD 51.8 per share, implying a 30% upside potential from the current price. - XPeng's fair value is estimated to be USD 24.8 per share, implying a 20% downside potential from the current price. ## Risk Factors and Considerations ### Political Risks - The Chinese government's policies and regulations on the EV industry could change, affecting the growth prospects of Li Auto and XPeng. - The geopolitical tensions between China and other countries could also impact the EV industry and the companies' operations. ### Economic Risks - The economic slowdown in China or globally could reduce consumer demand for EVs and affect the companies' revenue and profitability. ### Market Risks - The competition in the EV market is intensifying, and Li Auto and XPeng face competition from established automakers and emerging EV startups. - The potential battery supply shortage could affect the companies' production and sales. ### Considerations - We believe that Li Auto's unique EREV technology and better operational efficiency can help it compete in the market and mitigate the risks. - We also consider the ESG factors, and Li Auto performs better in this aspect than XPeng, indicating better social responsibility. ## Other Reasons to Recommend - Li Auto's focus on quality and safety has earned it a high reputationin the market, which could potentially attract more customers and investors. - Li Auto has a strong research and development team, with a focus on developing cutting-edge technologies to improve its vehicles' performance and safety. - Li Auto has a strong brand recognition and a loyal customer base, which could potentially lead to higher customer retention and word-of-mouth marketing. ## Conclusion Based on our analysis, we recommend a long position in Li Auto and a short position in XPeng. Li Auto's better revenue and margin, unique EREV technology, and undervaluation make it an attractive investment opportunity. Additionally, Li Auto's stronger ESG performance and brand recognition add to its potential for long-term growth. While there are political and market risks in the EV industry in China, we believe that Li Auto's strong fundamentals and unique technology can help mitigate these risks.

text: Background and objectives: The mortality rate for people with brain injuries is increased when hypernatremia is present. Patients with severe hypernatremia, who have a significant short-term mortality rate, were shown to benefit from continuous venovenous hemofiltration (CVVH), which has been indicated to be successful. Exploring the risk factors for short-term mortality in brain injury patients who underwent CVVH and had severe hypernatremia was the aim of the current study. Materials and Methods: Retrospective screening was performed on patients with brain injuries who underwent CVVH at Xijing Hospital between 1 December 2010 and 31 December 2021 and who have a diagnosis of severe hypernatremia. The outcomes included 28-day patient mortality and hospital stay duration. The patient survival rate was examined using the Kaplan-Meier survival curve. To determine the risk factors for short-term death for patients, univariate and multivariate Cox regression analysis models were used. Results: Our current study included a total of 83 individuals. The included patients had a median age of 49 (IQR 35-59) years. Of the included patients, 58 patients (69.9%) died within 28 days. The median length of hospital stay for the patient was 13 (IQR 7-21) days. The APACHE II score, SOFA score, GCS, PLT count, INR, stroke, mechanical ventilation, and vasopressor reliance were related to 28-day mortality according to the univariate Cox analysis. INR (HR = 1.004, 95% Cl: 1.001-1.006, P = 0.008), stroke (HR = 1.971, 95% Cl: 1.031-3.768, P = 0.04), mechanical ventilation (HR = 3.948, 95% Cl: 1.090-14.294, P = 0.036), and vasopressor dependency (HR = 2.262, 95% Cl: 1.099-4.655, P = 0.027) were independently associated with the risk of 28-day death rates, according to multivariate Cox regression analysis. Conclusions: Brain injuries who have severe hypernatremia requires CVVH, which has high short-term patient mortality. Mechanical ventilation, INR increase, stroke, and vasopressor dependence are independently associated with increased patient mortality risk.

text: Story prompt: It is 1908. Irish author Bram Stoker is made aware of a seemingly insignificant series of short novels that have gained positive attraction. The novels consist of a morally grey heroic figure and their travels across the world. Despite the original character and unique setting, it was everything else that wasn’t original. The hero encountered the likes of Sherlock Holmes, a character created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. In other instances, this figure traveled through time with the very same time machine featured in H.G. Wells' story "The Time Machine", or perhaps traveled alongside Ebenezer Scrooge. This author even wrote stories where his character and Sherlock Holmes involved in the affairs of the Jane Austen novel "Pride and Prejudice" and did battles with Mr. Hyde or encountering Frankenstein’s monster from Mary Shelly's "Frankenstein" and Count Dracula, Stoker’s own creation. Instead of being standalone stories, an unknown author had thought to mix his own original ideas with the works of others.

text: Social media release for: Public Service Announcement: Unprotected Beaches and Potential Risks The Longport Police Department would like to remind the public about the risks associated with swimming at unprotected beaches. As the official beach patrol season comes to a close, the number of protected beaches within Longport has been reduced for the next few weeks. Swimming at unprotected beaches can be dangerous due to various factors such as unpredictable undertows, rip currents, and lack of immediate assistance in case of an emergency. The absence of trained lifeguards further increases the risks and can potentially lead to life-threatening situations as seen most recently at local beaches along Absecon Island. Therefore, it is strongly advised to avoid swimming at unprotected beaches during the off season, especially as we are now in the hurricane season. Longport PD remains committed to safeguarding the community and reminds all residents and visitors to prioritize their safety by making informed decisions regarding beach activities. It is essential to be vigilant, follow safety guidelines, and be aware of any updates or changes provided by local authorities. For additional information, updates, and safety tips, please follow our official Longport Police Department social media channels (Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter) or visit our website. Stay safe and enjoy the start to our fall season responsibly!

text: rewrite this essay in the style of Harmonie Korine, Hello all, just a quick note on me and my AI journey. It all began in the fall of 2022 when a friend (shout out to the homey Chris) alerted me to this new magical AI application called Midjourney. It would blow me away he told me, allow me to create my own illustrations of whatever my mind could conjure, in whatever style I could imagine. That one conversation took me down an AI art rabbit hole I have yet to emerge from! Since then I have used AI applications (Kaiber, Moonvalley, Pika, Runway, Play HT, DiD, along with my Adobe Suite and self taught design skills) to create everything from Murals, to Comic Books, 100's of T-Shirt Designs, Music Videos, Flyers, Animated Shorts, Animated Sequences for Documentaries and TV Shows, Graphics, Interstitials, tons of Social Media Content and more. In addition I have taught what I've learned in classes with youth and adults on the Caribbean island of Montserrat and at the University of North Florida. While I've covered wide areas of AI usage in art, video and sound, the one area that I had yet to enter successfully was the utilization of AI to write a script. I had attempted this a year ago when the tech wasn't quite ready and I didn't have a technique. I was writing a spec script on the life of John and Alice Coltrane. I asked AI to write me a scene featuring John and Alice Coltrane having an argument about his drug use in their kitchen. The AI ended up interpreting the "John" in my prompt as "John Travolta" and the "Alice" as "Alice in Wonderland". 5 pages of this junk. While interesting on the face of it, greatly frustrating and time wasting. This is what is called a "hallucination", when an AI model generates incorrect information but presents it as if it were a fact. Being as how I was writing a historical script, facts were invaluable to the process. So needless to say, I abandoned that potential boondoggle. But something was about to change. On a whim one month ago, I decided to apply for a potentially life changing opportunity. It is a grant for Latino writers who had a show concept in the drama genre featuring a Latino lead. 6 people are chosen to receive it and the winners get to pitch their show ideas before professional show runners and a big network. I found about about this with one week left before the application window was closing so I quickly got to work. Luckily I had written an entire Bible (a reference document used by screenwriters for information on characters, settings, and other elements of a film project) for a show idea 3 years ago that genre wise fit this contest well enough. It is called "Electro Is Dead" and without getting too deep into the plot basically, it is "The summer of 1988 in Venice Beach, CA. Dennis Juarez aka DJ Rey, Afro-Chicano teen Electro DJ, becomes enmeshed into a dark plot to bring about Hell on Earth."

text: I am doing the Kaggle competition “Titanic - Machine Learning from Disaster”, my code: "# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed # It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python # For example, here's several helpful packages to load import numpy as np # linear algebra import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv) # Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory # For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory import os for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'): for filename in filenames: print(os.path.join(dirname, filename)) # You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" # You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session train_data = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/titanic/train.csv") test_data = pd.read_csv("/kaggle/input/titanic/test.csv") train_data.head(100) from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer # Imputing Age age_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median') train_data['Age'] = age_imputer.fit_transform(train_data[['Age']]) test_data['Age'] = age_imputer.transform(test_data[['Age']]) # Assuming Fare missing values can be filled with -1 (or you could use mean or median) fare_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median') train_data['Fare'] = fare_imputer.fit_transform(train_data[['Fare']]) test_data['Fare'] = fare_imputer.transform(test_data[['Fare']]) features = ["Pclass", "Sex", "Age", "SibSp", "Parch", "Fare","Embarked","PassengerId"] X = pd.get_dummies(train_data[features]) X_test = pd.get_dummies(test_data[features]) y = train_data["Survived"] model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=200, max_depth=200, random_state=10) model.fit(X, y) predictions = model.predict(X_test) train_accuracy = model.score(X, y) print(f"Training Accuracy: {train_accuracy:.4f}") output = pd.DataFrame({'PassengerId': test_data.PassengerId, 'Survived': predictions}) output.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False) print("Your submission was successfully saved!") " I want to change the model to neural network, show code.

text: Story prompt: It is 1908. Irish author Bram Stoker is made aware of a seemingly insignificant series of short novels that have gained positive attraction. The novels consist of a morally grey heroic figure and their travels across the world. Despite the original character and unique setting, it was everything else that wasn’t original. The hero encountered the likes of Sherlock Holmes, a character created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. In other instances, this figure traveled through time with the very same time machine featured in H.G. Wells' story "The Time Machine", or perhaps traveled alongside Ebenezer Scrooge. This author even wrote stories where his character and Sherlock Holmes involved in the affairs of the Jane Austen novel "Pride and Prejudice" and did battles with Mr. Hyde or encountering Frankenstein’s monster from Mary Shelly's "Frankenstein" and Count Dracula, Stoker’s own creation. Instead of being standalone stories, an unknown author had thought to mix his own original ideas with the works of others.

text: To our colleagues in the healthcare community: We know that 2020 had its fair share of challenges. Despite these challenges, you have courageously prioritized the health of your members and patients. We are grateful and honored to have served so many of you as your trusted partner this past year. As 2021 begins, our country’s healthcare system faces a year of rebuilding and moving forward into a new future. The norms in our industry have changed significantly with the push toward adoption of new technology to drive better communication and efficiency. MCG Health looks forward to this more advanced healthcare ecosystem. We are well-positioned to help address your clinical and business needs with our proven industry-leading guidelines and software solutions coupled with advanced technology. Through connected, interoperable, smart systems, MCG will help our customers deliver effective care while reducing administrative burden. By now, you’ve heard the recent news that UnitedHealth Group’s Optum will acquire Change Healthcare and their InterQual Guidelines. MCG wants to assure you of our ongoing commitment to our customers across the healthcare continuum. Unlike Change Healthcare, MCG Health has always been a private company. We intend to remain private under Hearst Health in order to provide the most patient-centered, unbiased, evidence-based guidelines in the market, without the influence of specialty societies, regulatory bodies, customers, or special interests. Our mission is to drive optimal outcomes for healthcare consumers. MCG is well-resourced and on a strong trajectory of growth. We promise to continue delivering the best customer service for our esteemed clients and partners and are committed to our customers’ success. MCG is proud of our independence and the rigor of our content development process that, for decades, has provided the most patient-centric, outcome-oriented guidelines on the market. With the addition of investments made in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence, we are excited about the future. As you have come to expect from MCG, we will communicate openly to address any questions you may have regarding this industry news or any MCG matter. Please reach out to us if you’d like to discuss any issues or concerns.

text: change this to a matrix business structure A local Egyptian pajama business may choose to use a functional business structure. In this type of structure, teams are organized based on their specific functions, such as sales, marketing, production, and finance. Each team is headed by a functional manager who is responsible for supervising and coordinating their team’s activities. One advantage of a functional structure for this type of business is that it ensures clear lines of authority and responsibility. Each team knows what their specific function is and is accountable for delivering the results within that area. It can also be more efficient as each team can focus on their area of expertise and work to optimize processes and procedures. However, a functional structure can also result in silos where each team works independently and may not communicate effectively with other teams. This can lead to information hoarding and hinder innovation or problem-solving across the business. Additionally, as each team is focused on their own function, there may be less collaboration and creativity across departments. Ultimately, the choice of business structure will depend on the size, scope, and goals of the local Egyptian pyjama business. A functional structure may be more suitable for the business if it has a clear and defined set of functions with little need for collaboration across teams.

text: Write a 250-word introduction for the following essay: Change Proposal #1: Foster Personal Connections to HHV Health and Human Values is a minor that aims to foster growth of individuals as they pursue careers in health and health care. It prompts students to reflect on issues related to health with an interdisciplinary lens and think about how they can make an impact now and in the future. HHV is not intended to purely be a stepping stone to medical school or graduate school. However, some students state that they are in HHV because it will look good on their resume. In addition, many students express frustration with the assignments in HNRS 250 and do not understand how the readings and reflections connect to their journey in the minor. Another challenge is that sometimes students may conform to the values expressed by Dr. Braitberg or other professors rather than articulating their own opinion. We suggest that HHV make changes that prompt students to develop personal connections to their work in the minor. One change to foster personal connections is to integrate group values into HHV starting in the HNRS 250 class. Group values are a set of beliefs held by a group of people that inform their actions as they work together. By creating group values among each cohort and HHV as a whole, students will feel that their work in HHV is more meaningful to them and will be more invested in the program. Establishing group agreements as students begin HNRS 250 is a great way to start integrating group values in HHV. Group agreements are a set of rules agreed to by the group to create a learning environment in which students are comfortable and enthusiastic engaging in. Examples of group agreements in PATH are Listen Actively, Build the Change, and Uphold Confidentiality. Dr. Braitberg, Dr. Oberman, or other professors teaching HNRS 250 should first prompt students to reflect on what their personal values are which could include Integrity, Justice, and Health. Students can then have discussions about their individual values as a class and make connections with the values of the group and the minor. Then, the professors should have the students brainstorm group agreements that integrate group values. A challenge to this exercise may be that students will be reluctant to participate, especially as underclassmen. The professors can initiate the discussion and make connections between the values of students, but they should be careful not to dominate the activity. These group agreements should be practiced throughout HNRS 250. In addition, there should be more assignments and readings in HNRS 250, the capstone, and internship that require students to reflect on their individual and group values and how they relate to issues in health and healthcare. If students find their own values integrated more in HHV, they will be more invested and engaged as well as find value in the program beyond being a stepping stone. Change Proposal #2: Create More Experiential Learning Opportunities in the Minor The HHV minor places a focus on understanding the social, ethical, cultural, political, and structural factors shape health, disease, and health care. Such an understanding, especially that of an interdisciplinary nature, requires students to be able to critically think about different social issues related to health care. However, one of the concerns with regard to the HHV minor is that there is less student engagement, and one of the reasons for this decreased engagement may be that students sometimes may struggle to understand how the content they are learning in their HHV classes applies directly to their future careers or the communities, institutions, and other settings they are part of in the real-world. Such confusion or lack of understanding can also decrease student engagement. One of the ways to foster critical thinking as well as increase student engagement is through creating more experiential learning opportunities in the minor. Students really value the opportunity to speak with people from different community organizations that address different issues like poverty, homelessness, disability justice, etc that are discussed in the HHV classes. Having an opportunity to speak to more guest speakers can enable students to more clearly see how the content they discuss in class can be applied to the real-world and thus engage with the minor and peers more often. Through experiential learning opportunities such as volunteering and service learning, students will also have the chance to interact with different people and communities that experience the social and health issues discussed in class. This will increase students’ empathy and understanding as well as foster a passion for justice and creating change. Ultimately, experiential learning can increase students’ feelings of citizenship in the minor and ability to think about creating organic change within their own communities. Additionally, students may sometimes feel overwhelmed with too many readings and the same class structure for every class, which can also lead to decreased engagement. One way to potentially address this issue is to prioritize quality over quantity. For instance, organizing field trips to different community organizations (especially for the 250 class) in place of some regular class readings and discussions can allow students to engage with class content in a different learning environment, which can also help increase engagement and allow for a deeper understanding and connection to course material. Furthermore, creating opportunities for meaningful reflections after such experiences can enable students to reflect on their personal growth and consider numerous other career opportunities both in and outside of healthcare to address the issues they are most passionate about. Change Proposal #3: Improve Organization and Structure of HHV Classes We would like to propose an increase in overall structure and organization of the Health and Human Values classes. Establishing a clear structure that is well organized gives students peace of mind and helps them succeed academically. An essential part of any relationship is setting clear expectations of each party. In the context of a student-teacher relationship, a teacher needs to establish their expectations of the student for their class. We would recommend that a syllabus is established by the first day of class. This way, the student is able to fully understand what is expected of them from the beginning. The student can plan accordingly and ensure that the class is the right fit for them and their schedule. We also recommend that the syllabus remain relatively consistent throughout the semester and within cohorts. This would provide students with a sense of stability in addition to clear expectations. Regarding the organization of classes, we recommend that classes follow a similar structure between cohorts. Something that we have noted as mentors is that when talking with mentees, it seems that the class structure has changed since we have taken the class. Although the core values of the HHV minor are always present, it may help give students peace of mind if they knew what to expect of the introduction and the capstone course. Developing a framework that each class follows could still allow for changes from year to year, but the framework would be able to give the class some consistency. The framework could be used by other professors in the future as well. Anonymous student feedback surveys may help Dr. Braitberg to learn more about what students would like to see from the organization and structure of the HHV minor. Although there is a university wide end of semester student course survey, we believe that Dr. Braitberg should have students fill out an anonymous survey that is more specific to the organization and structure of the class. This could provide Dr. Braitberg with more helpful insight into what students would like to see with regards to structure and organization. Change Proposal #4: Increase Inter-Cohort and Alumni Support/Connection The Health and Human values minor has a diverse group of majors, internships, and various opportunities that are available to the community. However, there are rarely settings where these are shared across cohorts. The first time that we were able to share our own opportunities/experiences in depth was as mentors in the 250 course. A potential way to enrich participation in the minor is through events where sharing these opportunities is celebrated and encouraged. Thus, HHV social events one or two every semester, where HHV students in the internship, capstone, and core introductory course are required to attend would start the spread of information about unique opportunities that are available in the healthcare space. Another method to increase the inter-cohort support by other undergraduate mentors would be an HHV preceptorship for the 250 course in the spring. A preceptorship encourages dialogue between more HHV seniors and newer students in the minor. A peer mentor has the advantage of being more approachable, the shared experience of being a student in the course, and could reduce the grading workload for faculty (for smaller assignments like discussion posts). When most people enter their internship, most talk to Dr. Braitberg and the person who previously was in the internship before them, but rarely get the opportunity to see presentations about internships that are available to them. Therefore, there should be a database of posters/recorded presentations that students can watch if they are unable to come to the peer capstone/internship academic poster session. The HHV minor has multiple graduating classes, but there seems to be a lack of alumni support from those that are outside of the minor. Therefore, it is imperative that alumni offer advice and support to students that are trying to find their path through the HHV minor and beyond. There should be a form/spreadsheet with the contact information of graduated HHV students along with a note (if possible) of what their plans were immediately after graduation. This would allow HHV mentors to start connecting with alumni near graduation and could become something that could be advertised to increase the amount of people that apply to HHV. HHV is an Honors minor, but there seems to be a limited connection between it and the remainder of the Honors College. An idea that should be discussed further is offering interdisciplinary approaches to problems by offering collaborative work sessions or seminars between HHV students and other Honors minors.

We aim to inspire travelers to explore Costa Rica responsibly while highlighting initiatives that prioritize conservation and community engagement. Could you please generate blog ideas that showcase unique eco-adventures, sustainable accommodations, local conservation efforts, and tips for responsible travel in Costa Rica? We want our content to resonate with environmentally conscious travelers, offering them valuable insights into immersive experiences that leave a positive impact on both the environment and local communities. Thank you for your creativity and assistance in crafting engaging blog topics that reflect our commitment to sustainable travel in Costa Rica!"

Caviish is responsible to serve the Sustainable Development Goals by working to achieve Goal #12 Responsible Consumption and Production via: Offsetting the remaining carbon emissions! Calculate the carbon footprint and purchase climate credits from Climate Neutral Now. In this way, we’ll help reduce global emissions faster! Using the hashtag #globalgoals on social networks to tell UN about our actions to achieve the global goals. Adopt sustainable practices by integrate sustainability information into reporting cycle. Promote public procurement practices that are sustainable, in accordance with national policies and priorities. Participating to ensure that people everywhere have the relevant information and awareness for sustainable development and lifestyles in harmony with nature by 2030. Caviish substantially reduce waste generation through reusing celebrity’s belongings. We are actively working to drive global change. Celebrities’s consignment through Caviish will keep million items in circulation, while saving billion liters of water and thousands metric tons of carbon. At a time when one garbage truck’s worth of textiles is landfilled or burned every second, driving awareness of resale and sustainability is crucial. That’s why we put sustainability in the spotlight: in our marketing and advertising, throughout our shopping experience, and in conversation with both our community and the industry. As a result, we’re participating to change the way people shop by teaching them that environmental impact or extending the life cycle of luxury are key motivators for selling and buying. Educating and empowering consumers to make more sustainable choices is driving us to develop a sustainability calculator that quantifies the impact of resale on the planet. text: Think a title for :Rose Alex was in my cabin, talking about the overall idea that I might be expecting from him. I told him all I have and he noted it down in a notepad when Sarah came to my office to call me for the outfit trials. I'm so glad to have her work for my secretory. Joseph was the one to recommend her for her efficient skills and poised demeanour as she talks with people. I have reasons to believe they’ve worked together in the past. Walking towards the trial rooms, I couldn't help but notice the tension radiating from Joseph as he watched Alex and I coming through. His irritated expression perplexed me, considering he had been the one to choose Alex as the director. He was even thankful earlier when Alex confirmed to give us dates for the shoots, as it deemed to me like a big deal. Why wouldn’t it be, Alex is known to be the best in the field. It seemed now that there was some unspoken history between them. Entering the room on the first floor, I observed racks of costumes neatly arranged on hangers, waiting to be tried on. The walls were adorned with sketches and fabric swatches, adding an artistic touch to the space. A full-length mirror stood in one corner, ready to reflect the transformation of the actors. Sean, the designer approached us, his tone slightly curt. “Rose, glad you could make it. We need your opinion on the costumes. The actors are waiting.” I nodded, acknowledging his request. “I'm eager to see the outfits myself. Let's get started.” The actors began trying on their costumes as Sean suggested. The first apparels they came out wearing formal patterns, shirts and long pants. “Light cotton fabrics with detailed embroidery and flowy patterns should suit more to the theme.” I observed.” Sean nodded, picking out the types of outfits I suggested from the hanger. Alex leaned in closer to me, a mischievous glimmer in his eyes. “Rose, you have a way of making even costume trials exciting. I can't help but admire your attention to detail.” I chuckled, feeling a slight blush creep onto my cheeks. “Well, it's all about creating the perfect look, isn't it? Every little detail matters.” Meanwhile, Joseph sat nearby, his crossed arms and furrowed brows indicating his displeasure. Alex, seemingly unfazed, couldn't resist teasing him. “Joseph, don't worry. I won't steal your spotlight. I'm just here to bring Rose's vision to life.” Joseph's response was curt. “Just make sure you do your job, Alex. That’s what we are paying you for.” I laughed awkwardly. “Let’s focus on work.” The tension between them was palpable, and I couldn't help but feel caught in the middle, like literally. If it wasn’t for work, I don’t think I will ever be able to handle them together. So, I focused on the actors, offering feedback on the costumes and engaging in lighthearted banter to lighten the mood. Oh completely, utterly useless. Emma twirled in her vibrant floral maxi dress, her eyes sparkling with excitement. “Rose, what do you think? Does this costume capture your vision of my character?” I examined her outfit, considering its fit and overall aesthetic. “Emma, you look stunning. The costume perfectly embodies your character. It's elegant yet approachable but I think there is something missing here. what do you think Alex?” “Yeah!” he nodded. Jake joined in, a mischievous grin on his face. “Rose, do you think this costume will make me look dashing enough to win over hearts?” I playfully rolled my eyes. “Jake, with your charm, you don't need a costume to win hearts. But yes, this one adds an extra touch of charisma.” As the actors continued trying on different outfits, Alex took the opportunity to talk playfully with me. “Rose, it really doesn’t seem like your first project. You seem to have a great foresight.” I blushed, trying to hide my smile, proud of what I've accomplished thanks to Joseph. But he is farther to happiness as he can be. He is sitting brooding for some reason. “Alex, you know how to charm a girl, don't you?” Sean teased. “But let's focus on the task at hand, shall we? There is a lot of work and much less time.” “Yes, Alex let’s work now. we can talk about other things later.” Joseph, seemingly unable to ignore our interaction, interjected. “We're here to work, not flirt, Alex.” Alex smirked, undeterred. “Joseph, no need to be jealous. You had your chance with Rose. It's my turn now.” My eyes widened in surprise, and I quickly redirected the conversation. “Alright, enough banter, gentlemen. Let's get back to the costumes. We need to ensure that every detail is perfect.” The costume trial continued amidst the playful exchanges and occasional jabs between Alex and Joseph. As we narrowed down the options and made final decisions, a sense of excitement and satisfaction filled inside me. Despite the underlying tension, I couldn't help but find the situation amusing. There was something comical about the contrasting personalities and their playful rivalry. One can't help but smile, other is sitting on the chair like a sulking child. While everyone else are talking and sharing opinions. The actors began trying on the chosen outfits, one after the other, swirling around to give us a good look. Sean carefully observed their fits, making minor adjustments here and there. Tweaking one safety pin behind or another on the side. Emma raised her concerns about the length of her dress, while Jake argued that his shirt felt too tight around the collar. There are many more adjustments that is gonna be needed for Sean to complete in a few days. In the midst of their debates, Joseph and Alex chimed in with their opinions. Joseph, ever the advocate for bold choices, insisted, “We need some vibrant shades to bring out the characters' personalities. We have very little time to showcase a story. it will be better if they can use the help of their outfits.” He is not wrong, but that would make them contrasted. We need to follow a color theme. Alex, on the other hand, countered, “I believe pastels and fresh colors are more in line with the current trends. It will give the production a modern touch.” Observing the two men on either side of me, I couldn't help but feel caught in the middle. I carefully considered their opinions before voicing my own. “I think Alex has a point. Pastels would indeed give a refreshing and contemporary vibe to the costumes. And since we are following a summer vibe, I think that should be considered.” A proud smile formed on Alex's lips, while Joseph's irritation was evident. However, before Joseph could express his dissent, his phone rang, and he excused himself to take the call. His sudden departure left an awkward silence in the room. Everyone adjust to the little awkwardness that still remained and started again with the work. Taking advantage of the moment, Alex leaned closer to me, a playful glimmer in his eyes. “Rose, I must say, your taste in fashion aligns perfectly with mine. I'm glad we're on the same page.” I chuckled, feeling a mixture of excitement and confusion. “It seems we have a shared aesthetic, Alex. Let's hope it translates well into the production.” Just as we were conversing, Joseph returned unexpectedly, his eyes narrowing as he witnessed us talking. A surge of anger flashed across his face before he abruptly turned and stormed back to his office, leaving us puzzled. The costume designer, sensing the tension, tried to diffuse the situation. “Well, Rose, Alex, the fittings are almost complete. Overall, I believe the costumes are shaping up wonderfully. The colors and styles complement the characters' personalities perfectly.” I nodded, grateful for the designer's input. “Thank you for your hard work. Please get started with the fittings. We’ll start filming from next week.” As the actors continued changing outfits to their clothes when Alex added, “how about we share contacts, I'll call you soon as my assistant confirm the location?” I hesitated for a moment, glancing around to ensure no prying eyes were watching, before sharing my contact information with him. Our exchange didn't go unnoticed by Joseph, who had returned to the room, his eyes fixed on us. His anger was palpable as he silently observed Alex's demeanor. His reaction perplexed me. I couldn't understand why he was acting so mad, especially considering he had chosen Alex as the director. His sudden withdrawal, retreating to his room for the rest of the discussion only added to my confusion. Despite the underlying tension, I tried to maintain a sense of professionalism. I engaged in discussions with the actors, providing feedback on the costumes and offering encouragement. However, the absence of Joseph's presence weighed heavily on the atmosphere. Done for the day, I couldn't help but feel a mixture of excitement and apprehension for the upcoming production. The dynamic between Alex and Joseph had certainly added an unexpected twist to the process. I could only hope that their differences would ultimately contribute to the success of the project, rather than hinder it. Everyone already went home when I walked into Joseph's office, holding the photographs of the chosen outfits and makeup styles in my hands. His reaction was far from what I expected. He simply nodded and took the photos without saying anything other than, “I'll see it.” Concern etched across my face, I couldn't help but wonder if he was sick. So, I asked, “Joseph, is something wrong? Are you feeling unwell?” He shook his head dismissively. “No, I'm fine. Just a bit preoccupied with work, that's all.” I sighed relief. I've been in the mistake of thinking that I've done something to annoy him. but if it isn’t for me, it must have something to do with Alex. Sensing his distance, I mustered up the courage to extend an invitation. “You know, Joseph, I've been meaning to thank you for everything you've done. How about I take you and Mark out for dinner? It'll be my treat.” He waved his hand, brushing off my offer. “No need to bother. You can go ahead with your plans for the date you've set up with Alex.” His response caught me off guard. Confusion clouded my thoughts as I searched for an explanation. “Joseph, I don't understand. Why are you acting this way? What do you mean by 'the date you’ve set up'? I'm not going on any date.” With mounting frustration, he unleashed his pent-up anger. His words cut through me like a sharp blade. “We are here for work, Rose! Not to indulge in romantic entanglements. Don't you get that? I've begged everyone because I saw potential in you, but for some days I'm seeing you are more occupied with something else.” His outburst left me speechless, my emotions teetering on the edge. I've been working even after leaving office. Still planning everything meticulously. How can his accusatory tone make me feel so disappointed. “Fine! If you are going to do this, I'll better leave you alone.” Unable to bear his accusations any longer, I quietly left his office and retreated to my own. The weight of his words lingered, leaving me with a sense of hurt and confusion. As I closed the door behind me, I sank into my chair, struggling to make sense of Joseph's sudden anger. What had I done to deserve such treatment? I had simply been trying to foster a positive working environment and extend my gratitude for all his help. The room felt suffocating, and I longed for answers. I couldn't help but question why Joseph's frustrations were being directed at me. Had I unknowingly crossed a boundary? The more I pondered, the more frustrated and disheartened I became. Feeling a mix of emotions, I resolved to give Joseph some space, hoping that he would eventually explain his outburst. It was clear that tensions were running high, and I had no desire to exacerbate the situation further. The silence enveloping me, I couldn't shake off the nagging feeling of confusion and disappointment. This unexpected turn of events had cast a shadow over our once harmonious working relationship, leaving me yearning for resolution and understanding. But for the day, I'm going to go home and not think about it anymore.

text: please rephrase this paragraph 'The rosemary aqueous extract alleviates the nephrotoxicity induced by CCL4 in albino rats (Sakr et al., 2012). The protective effect of rosemary can be explained that rosemary extract has a high scavenging capacity of different types of reactive oxygen and nitrogen species, mostly free radicals, as thought to be one of the main mechanisms of the antioxidant action exhibited by phenolic phytochemicals (Moreno et al., 2006). Also, the rosemary aqueous extract alleviates the toxicity induced by lead on the kidney through stimulation of endogenous antioxidant defense system (Abdelkader et al., 2012). In addition, rosemary has anti inflammatory action (Altinier et al., 2007).'

text: Background and objectives: The mortality rate for people with brain injuries is increased when hypernatremia is present. Patients with severe hypernatremia, who have a significant short-term mortality rate, were shown to benefit from continuous venovenous hemofiltration (CVVH), which has been indicated to be successful. Exploring the risk factors for short-term mortality in brain injury patients who underwent CVVH and had severe hypernatremia was the aim of the current study. Materials and Methods: Retrospective screening was performed on patients with brain injuries who underwent CVVH at Xijing Hospital between 1 December 2010 and 31 December 2021 and who have a diagnosis of severe hypernatremia. The outcomes included 28-day patient mortality and hospital stay duration. The patient survival rate was examined using the Kaplan-Meier survival curve. To determine the risk factors for short-term death for patients, univariate and multivariate Cox regression analysis models were used. Results: Our current study included a total of 83 individuals. The included patients had a median age of 49 (IQR 35-59) years. Of the included patients, 58 patients (69.9%) died within 28 days. The median length of hospital stay for the patient was 13 (IQR 7-21) days. The APACHE II score, SOFA score, GCS, PLT count, INR, stroke, mechanical ventilation, and vasopressor reliance were related to 28-day mortality according to the univariate Cox analysis. INR (HR = 1.004, 95% Cl: 1.001-1.006, P = 0.008), stroke (HR = 1.971, 95% Cl: 1.031-3.768, P = 0.04), mechanical ventilation (HR = 3.948, 95% Cl: 1.090-14.294, P = 0.036), and vasopressor dependency (HR = 2.262, 95% Cl: 1.099-4.655, P = 0.027) were independently associated with the risk of 28-day death rates, according to multivariate Cox regression analysis. Conclusions: Brain injuries who have severe hypernatremia requires CVVH, which has high short-term patient mortality. Mechanical ventilation, INR increase, stroke, and vasopressor dependence are independently associated with increased patient mortality risk.

INR (HR = 1.004, 95% Cl: 1.001-1.006, P = 0.008), stroke (HR = 1.971, 95% Cl: 1.031-3.768, P = 0.04), mechanical ventilation (HR = 3.948, 95% Cl: 1.090-14.294, P = 0.036), and vasopressor dependency (HR = 2.262, 95% Cl: 1.099-4.655, P = 0.027) were independently associated with the risk of 28-day death rates, according to multivariate Cox regression analysis. Conclusions: Brain injuries who have severe hypernatremia requires CVVH, which has high short-term patient mortality. Mechanical ventilation, INR increase, stroke, and vasopressor dependence are independently associated with increased patient mortality risk.

In my home country of Iran, individuals must endure extreme poverty, which may hinder their comprehension of the subject matter. I was born and raised in Tehran, where many people suffer from various diseases, some of which are preventable. Throughout my time there, I never contemplated who would provide assistance or raise awareness. After completing my doctoral degree in dentistry and undertaking crucial courses on Epidemiology and general public health, I witnessed even more dire situations. Additionally, I currently work as a dentist at the Sina Dental Clinic, a public health center near my hometown in Iran, and I have come to understand that people are afflicted with numerous dangerous diseases that could be prevented through enhanced knowledge of Epidemiology and public health. For being more prepared for this program, I actively sought to participate in various workshops during my education. I successfully completed a Clinical Epidemiology workshop and biostatistics courses at the Arca Science institute. text: Due to their hydrophobic nature, pentacyclic triterpenoids are almost insoluble in water. They are classified in the biopharmaceutical classification system as class IV drugs as their pharmacological effects are limited due to their low solubility in water and potential difficulty in permeating biological membranes [78]. For these reasons, some new approaches have been introduced to enhance their biopharmaceutical properties, particularly drug delivery technologies. At present, nano-emulsions, mesoporous silica nanoparticles, solid lipid nanoparticles, liposomes, niossomal gels and solid dispersions have been proposed quite successfully [79]; however, most of these studies were performed in experimental animals, and research in humans is very scarce, despite the great therapeutic potential of these natural biocompounds. Table 1 summarizes the current knowledge of OA pharmacokinetics in humans after oral single-dose administration. Song et al. [80] reported the results of a pharmacokinetic study performed with 18 healthy male Chinese volunteers, in which the participants received a single dose of 40 mg OA (capsule preparation). Venous blood samples were collected for 48 h, and the plasma was analyzed for OA contents. The area under the plasma OA concentration–time curve (AUC) was determined in 124.3 ± 106.7 ng h/mL, with a peak OA concentration of 12.1 ± 6.8 ng/mL, which was registered at 5.2 ± 2.9 h after the OA intake. Later on, a randomized, crossover and self-control study was carried out with 18 healthy Chinese male volunteers, who received 20 mg OA orally, formulated as normal tablets and dispersible tablets [81]. The resulting pharmacokinetic parameters included AUC values of 112.2 ± 56.6 and 109.7 ± 41.6 ng h/mL, for normal and dispersible tablets, respectively, and OA peak concentrations of 18.9 ± 8.0 and 17.8 ± 7.5 ng/mL, which were recorded at 2.9 ± 1.2 and 2.5 ± 1.0 h after the triterpene administration. In 2015, Rada et al. informed on a pharmacokinetic study developed with nine adult men, who were administered 30 mg OA dissolved in 70 g of pomace olive oil. The reported AUC value was 3181.9 ± 894.3 ng h/mL, with an OA maximum concentration of 598.2 ± 176.7 ng/mL, achieved at 3.0 ± 0.8 h after the intake of the OA-containing oil. The administered OA dose revealed a distribution volume of 81.4 ± 9.7 L, and removal half-lives of 4.6 ± 1.1 h. The 30 mg OA oral dose yielded a total clearance of 35.1 ± 4.2 L/h [82]. More recently, de la Torre et al. [83] reported that an administration of 4.7 mg of OA within 30 mL of olive oil to 12 individuals led to a maximum concentration of 5.1 ± 2.1 ng/mL in plasma 4 h after the intake.

text: Please check the following sports betting analysis by Mike Valenti for grammar, fluency, and prose: The penultimate West Regional first-round game of the Tournament features the No. 4 Alabama Crimson Tide and the No. 13 Charleston Cougars. The Tide are considerable favorites laying nine and a half to the Cougars. So, here's what your choices are in this game. Are you betting on Alabama's first three months, or you betting their last one? Alabama is in a full-blown swoon. This is the second best offense in the country and they play at a top-ten tempo. 'Bama is a flight-risk to score a hundred on any given night—if you don't believe me, go look for yourself. Charleston was a bit of a darling in last year's Tournament. My question on Alabama: how do you cover a ten-point spread, if you never get a stop on defense? How do you over ten when the other team is absolutely capable of seizing the advantage from three-point land? Charlestown attempted over a thousand three-pointers on the season. The Cougars are absolutely committed to shooting from deep, even if they're down. Let's say 'Bama is up by twenty in the late stages of the game, the College of Charleston is going to keep gripping and ripping. I thought the nine and a half point spread was interesting. Full disclosure: I've got a bit of loyalty to the College of Charleston. A guy I went to high school with in Troy, Pooty, attended CoC and played golf. And that was back when the College of Charleston was in the Trans America Athletic Conference, or the TAAC. They had a player named Thaddeous Delaney, and you know what his nickname was? The Shaq of the TAAC. This was mid-90s bread right here. But, CoC had been on the radar for Mikey here for quite some time. But I'm going to take the Cougars and the nine and a half here.

text: Hi Nyoka, I’m Kiki. I'm so sorry. I wonder if induction can be changed to Saturday? I really really want this job. I may have to leave Kaikoura to work in another city to make money, because I have no money. I really hope to get this job. I am also willing to learn. I can work any time and work longer days. You can work for up to six months. Hope to get your reply. Thank you so much.

text: Write a 250-word introduction for the following essay: Change Proposal #1: Foster Personal Connections to HHV Health and Human Values is a minor that aims to foster growth of individuals as they pursue careers in health and health care. It prompts students to reflect on issues related to health with an interdisciplinary lens and think about how they can make an impact now and in the future. HHV is not intended to purely be a stepping stone to medical school or graduate school. However, some students state that they are in HHV because it will look good on their resume. In addition, many students express frustration with the assignments in HNRS 250 and do not understand how the readings and reflections connect to their journey in the minor. Another challenge is that sometimes students may conform to the values expressed by Dr. Braitberg or other professors rather than articulating their own opinion. We suggest that HHV make changes that prompt students to develop personal connections to their work in the minor. One change to foster personal connections is to integrate group values into HHV starting in the HNRS 250 class. Group values are a set of beliefs held by a group of people that inform their actions as they work together. By creating group values among each cohort and HHV as a whole, students will feel that their work in HHV is more meaningful to them and will be more invested in the program. Establishing group agreements as students begin HNRS 250 is a great way to start integrating group values in HHV. Group agreements are a set of rules agreed to by the group to create a learning environment in which students are comfortable and enthusiastic engaging in. Examples of group agreements in PATH are Listen Actively, Build the Change, and Uphold Confidentiality. Dr. Braitberg, Dr. Oberman, or other professors teaching HNRS 250 should first prompt students to reflect on what their personal values are which could include Integrity, Justice, and Health. Students can then have discussions about their individual values as a class and make connections with the values of the group and the minor. Then, the professors should have the students brainstorm group agreements that integrate group values. A challenge to this exercise may be that students will be reluctant to participate, especially as underclassmen. The professors can initiate the discussion and make connections between the values of students, but they should be careful not to dominate the activity. These group agreements should be practiced throughout HNRS 250. In addition, there should be more assignments and readings in HNRS 250, the capstone, and internship that require students to reflect on their individual and group values and how they relate to issues in health and healthcare. If students find their own values integrated more in HHV, they will be more invested and engaged as well as find value in the program beyond being a stepping stone. Change Proposal #2: Create More Experiential Learning Opportunities in the Minor The HHV minor places a focus on understanding the social, ethical, cultural, political, and structural factors shape health, disease, and health care. Such an understanding, especially that of an interdisciplinary nature, requires students to be able to critically think about different social issues related to health care. However, one of the concerns with regard to the HHV minor is that there is less student engagement, and one of the reasons for this decreased engagement may be that students sometimes may struggle to understand how the content they are learning in their HHV classes applies directly to their future careers or the communities, institutions, and other settings they are part of in the real-world. Such confusion or lack of understanding can also decrease student engagement. One of the ways to foster critical thinking as well as increase student engagement is through creating more experiential learning opportunities in the minor. Students really value the opportunity to speak with people from different community organizations that address different issues like poverty, homelessness, disability justice, etc that are discussed in the HHV classes. Having an opportunity to speak to more guest speakers can enable students to more clearly see how the content they discuss in class can be applied to the real-world and thus engage with the minor and peers more often. Through experiential learning opportunities such as volunteering and service learning, students will also have the chance to interact with different people and communities that experience the social and health issues discussed in class. This will increase students’ empathy and understanding as well as foster a passion for justice and creating change. Ultimately, experiential learning can increase students’ feelings of citizenship in the minor and ability to think about creating organic change within their own communities. Additionally, students may sometimes feel overwhelmed with too many readings and the same class structure for every class, which can also lead to decreased engagement. One way to potentially address this issue is to prioritize quality over quantity. For instance, organizing field trips to different community organizations (especially for the 250 class) in place of some regular class readings and discussions can allow students to engage with class content in a different learning environment, which can also help increase engagement and allow for a deeper understanding and connection to course material. Furthermore, creating opportunities for meaningful reflections after such experiences can enable students to reflect on their personal growth and consider numerous other career opportunities both in and outside of healthcare to address the issues they are most passionate about. Change Proposal #3: Improve Organization and Structure of HHV Classes We would like to propose an increase in overall structure and organization of the Health and Human Values classes. Establishing a clear structure that is well organized gives students peace of mind and helps them succeed academically. An essential part of any relationship is setting clear expectations of each party. In the context of a student-teacher relationship, a teacher needs to establish their expectations of the student for their class. We would recommend that a syllabus is established by the first day of class. This way, the student is able to fully understand what is expected of them from the beginning. The student can plan accordingly and ensure that the class is the right fit for them and their schedule. We also recommend that the syllabus remain relatively consistent throughout the semester and within cohorts. This would provide students with a sense of stability in addition to clear expectations. Regarding the organization of classes, we recommend that classes follow a similar structure between cohorts. Something that we have noted as mentors is that when talking with mentees, it seems that the class structure has changed since we have taken the class. Although the core values of the HHV minor are always present, it may help give students peace of mind if they knew what to expect of the introduction and the capstone course. Developing a framework that each class follows could still allow for changes from year to year, but the framework would be able to give the class some consistency. The framework could be used by other professors in the future as well. Anonymous student feedback surveys may help Dr. Braitberg to learn more about what students would like to see from the organization and structure of the HHV minor. Although there is a university wide end of semester student course survey, we believe that Dr. Braitberg should have students fill out an anonymous survey that is more specific to the organization and structure of the class. This could provide Dr. Braitberg with more helpful insight into what students would like to see with regards to structure and organization. Change Proposal #4: Increase Inter-Cohort and Alumni Support/Connection The Health and Human values minor has a diverse group of majors, internships, and various opportunities that are available to the community. However, there are rarely settings where these are shared across cohorts. The first time that we were able to share our own opportunities/experiences in depth was as mentors in the 250 course. A potential way to enrich participation in the minor is through events where sharing these opportunities is celebrated and encouraged. Thus, HHV social events one or two every semester, where HHV students in the internship, capstone, and core introductory course are required to attend would start the spread of information about unique opportunities that are available in the healthcare space. Another method to increase the inter-cohort support by other undergraduate mentors would be an HHV preceptorship for the 250 course in the spring. A preceptorship encourages dialogue between more HHV seniors and newer students in the minor. A peer mentor has the advantage of being more approachable, the shared experience of being a student in the course, and could reduce the grading workload for faculty (for smaller assignments like discussion posts). When most people enter their internship, most talk to Dr. Braitberg and the person who previously was in the internship before them, but rarely get the opportunity to see presentations about internships that are available to them. Therefore, there should be a database of posters/recorded presentations that students can watch if they are unable to come to the peer capstone/internship academic poster session. The HHV minor has multiple graduating classes, but there seems to be a lack of alumni support from those that are outside of the minor. Therefore, it is imperative that alumni offer advice and support to students that are trying to find their path through the HHV minor and beyond. There should be a form/spreadsheet with the contact information of graduated HHV students along with a note (if possible) of what their plans were immediately after graduation. This would allow HHV mentors to start connecting with alumni near graduation and could become something that could be advertised to increase the amount of people that apply to HHV. HHV is an Honors minor, but there seems to be a limited connection between it and the remainder of the Honors College. An idea that should be discussed further is offering interdisciplinary approaches to problems by offering collaborative work sessions or seminars between HHV students and other Honors minors.
