Claude 3.0은 Opus, Sonnet, Haiku라는 3가지 모델로 이루어져있으며 각 모델은 성능뿐만 아니라 자체적인 윤리성도 검증했다고 합니다! 2024-03-12 | 이영빈 최근 거대언어모델(LLM)에 지각변동이 있는 모델이 공개되었습니다. 바로 Anthropic에서 만든 Claude 3.0 모델이 그 주인공입니다. Claude 3.0의 경우 처음 공개되었을때 GPT-4와 다르게 사회적 임팩트가 낮았다고 생각합니다. 그러나 점차 인공지능에 관심있는 사람들이 한두명씩 사용하기 시작하더니 많은 사람들이 GPT-4보다 더 나은 모델이 나왔다는 극찬을 했습니다. 필자 또한 Claude 3.0을 사용한 이후 GPT-4나 Gemini보다 훨씬 더 많이 사용하게 되고 있습니다. 이번 블로그에서는 Claude 3.0을 만든 Antropic이라는 회사를 알아보고 Claude 3.0에 대해서도 탐구해보겠습니다. Anthropic, OpenAI에서 뛰쳐나온 사람들이 만든회사 anthropic logo Anthropic은 회사의 근원부터 OpenAI와 연관되어 있습니다. 이전 블로그에서 작성했듯 OpenAI는 비영리기관으로 시작했다가 자금 문제가 발생해 OpenAI Global LLC라는 영리 자회사를 만들어서 운영하기 시작했습니다. 추가로 OpenAI는 2020년 GPT-3를 공개할 때 다른 기업들이 오픈소스를 외칠 때 API만 제공하는 방식으로 영리화하기 시작했습니다. 추가적으로 Microsoft와 OpenAI 영리 자회사가 협력관계를 갖기 시작했습니다. 이런 큰 변화에 있어서 기존에 있던 OpenAI 엔지니어들은 알트만의 행보에 반대하는 사람들이 있었으며 이들이 퇴사해서 만든 회사가 Anthropic입니다. 그렇기에 Anthropic은 OpenAI와 차별성을 두기 위해 공익회사임을 표방하고 있으며 미션 또한 ‘인류에게 도움이 되는 대규모 AI 시스템을 구축하는 것’입니다. 이때 AI 시스템은 반드시 안정성, 투명성, 윤리성에 가치를 두고 있어야 한다고 합니다. 이런 철학을 바탕으로 Anthropic은 자사만의 독특한 AI 학습 방식인 ‘헌신적 구성(Constitutional AI)’을 개발했습니다. 이는 AI 모델이 스스로 윤리 원칙을 체화하도록 학습시키는 것으로, 기존의 단순한 방식과는 차별화됩니다. 이를 통해 Anthropic은 강력하면서도 안전하고 신뢰할 수 있는 AI 시스템을 만들고자 합니다. Anthropic이 발표한 Claude는 2023년에 발표한 대화형 AI 모델을 선보였고 빠르게 버전업을 진행하고 있습니다. 이번에 발표한 Claude 3.0은 기존 Claude 모델들의 장점은 계승하면서 성능은 한층 더 높였습니다. Claude 3.0의 특징 Claude 3.0의 가장 큰 특징은 모델 크기의 다양화입니다. 기존의 Claude 1.0과 2.1은 하나의 모델로 제공되었던 반면, Claude 3.0은 Claude Haiku, Claude-Sonnet, Claude-Opus의 세 가지 버전으로 출시되었습니다. 각 모델은 규모와 성능에서 차이가 있어 사용자의 요구사항에 맞는 모델을 선택할 수 있게 되었습니다. 각 모델을 비교하기 앞서 우선 성능부터 확인해보겠습니다. Claude 3.0 benchmark Anthropic에서 제시한 Claude 3.0 성적표를 보면 놀랍습니다. (몇몇 사람들의 전망으로 3/14일이 GPT-4 1주년이 되는 해라서 무엇인가 준비하고 있지 않을까라는 루머가 있긴 합니다.) 앞으로의 전망 지금까지 Anthropic의 Claude 3.0에 대해 살펴보았습니다. 인공지능 기술이 나날이 발전하면서 우리 삶에 가져올 변화가 기대되는 한편, 부작용은 없을지 살짝 걱정도 됩니다. 앞으로도 AI가 가져올 혁신의 물결에 귀 기울이면서, 동시에 건전하고 지속가능한 발전 방향을 모색해 나가야 할 것 같습니다. 레퍼런스 Claude 3.0 소개글 이영빈 모두의연구소 🖥️ 모두의연구소 아이펠 퍼실리테이터 🏛️ JAX-KR 오거나이저 😎 GDG SongDo 오거나이저 목록으로 돌아가기 공유하기 (주)모두의연구소 | 대표 김승일 | 사업자등록번호 517-88-00184 | 개인정보보호정책 | FAQ | 1:1 문의 | 채용 | 오시는 길 서울 강남구 강남대로 324 (역삼디오슈페리움) 2층: 모두의연구소 강남캠퍼스 서울 강남구 역삼로 156 태광빌딩 2층: 모두의연구소 역삼캠퍼스 대전 중구 중앙로 119 대전테크노파크 디스테이션 12층 : 모두의연구소 대전캠퍼스 대표전화 070-7743-5882

text: Think a title for :Rose Alex was in my cabin, talking about the overall idea that I might be expecting from him. I told him all I have and he noted it down in a notepad when Sarah came to my office to call me for the outfit trials. I'm so glad to have her work for my secretory. Joseph was the one to recommend her for her efficient skills and poised demeanour as she talks with people. I have reasons to believe they’ve worked together in the past. Walking towards the trial rooms, I couldn't help but notice the tension radiating from Joseph as he watched Alex and I coming through. His irritated expression perplexed me, considering he had been the one to choose Alex as the director. He was even thankful earlier when Alex confirmed to give us dates for the shoots, as it deemed to me like a big deal. Why wouldn’t it be, Alex is known to be the best in the field. It seemed now that there was some unspoken history between them. Entering the room on the first floor, I observed racks of costumes neatly arranged on hangers, waiting to be tried on. The walls were adorned with sketches and fabric swatches, adding an artistic touch to the space. A full-length mirror stood in one corner, ready to reflect the transformation of the actors. Sean, the designer approached us, his tone slightly curt. “Rose, glad you could make it. We need your opinion on the costumes. The actors are waiting.” I nodded, acknowledging his request. “I'm eager to see the outfits myself. Let's get started.” The actors began trying on their costumes as Sean suggested. The first apparels they came out wearing formal patterns, shirts and long pants. “Light cotton fabrics with detailed embroidery and flowy patterns should suit more to the theme.” I observed.” Sean nodded, picking out the types of outfits I suggested from the hanger. Alex leaned in closer to me, a mischievous glimmer in his eyes. “Rose, you have a way of making even costume trials exciting. I can't help but admire your attention to detail.” I chuckled, feeling a slight blush creep onto my cheeks. “Well, it's all about creating the perfect look, isn't it? Every little detail matters.” Meanwhile, Joseph sat nearby, his crossed arms and furrowed brows indicating his displeasure. Alex, seemingly unfazed, couldn't resist teasing him. “Joseph, don't worry. I won't steal your spotlight. I'm just here to bring Rose's vision to life.” Joseph's response was curt. “Just make sure you do your job, Alex. That’s what we are paying you for.” I laughed awkwardly. “Let’s focus on work.” The tension between them was palpable, and I couldn't help but feel caught in the middle, like literally. If it wasn’t for work, I don’t think I will ever be able to handle them together. So, I focused on the actors, offering feedback on the costumes and engaging in lighthearted banter to lighten the mood. Oh completely, utterly useless. Emma twirled in her vibrant floral maxi dress, her eyes sparkling with excitement. “Rose, what do you think? Does this costume capture your vision of my character?” I examined her outfit, considering its fit and overall aesthetic. “Emma, you look stunning. The costume perfectly embodies your character. It's elegant yet approachable but I think there is something missing here. what do you think Alex?” “Yeah!” he nodded. Jake joined in, a mischievous grin on his face. “Rose, do you think this costume will make me look dashing enough to win over hearts?” I playfully rolled my eyes. “Jake, with your charm, you don't need a costume to win hearts. But yes, this one adds an extra touch of charisma.” As the actors continued trying on different outfits, Alex took the opportunity to talk playfully with me. “Rose, it really doesn’t seem like your first project. You seem to have a great foresight.” I blushed, trying to hide my smile, proud of what I've accomplished thanks to Joseph. But he is farther to happiness as he can be. He is sitting brooding for some reason. “Alex, you know how to charm a girl, don't you?” Sean teased. “But let's focus on the task at hand, shall we? There is a lot of work and much less time.” “Yes, Alex let’s work now. we can talk about other things later.” Joseph, seemingly unable to ignore our interaction, interjected. “We're here to work, not flirt, Alex.” Alex smirked, undeterred. “Joseph, no need to be jealous. You had your chance with Rose. It's my turn now.” My eyes widened in surprise, and I quickly redirected the conversation. “Alright, enough banter, gentlemen. Let's get back to the costumes. We need to ensure that every detail is perfect.” The costume trial continued amidst the playful exchanges and occasional jabs between Alex and Joseph. As we narrowed down the options and made final decisions, a sense of excitement and satisfaction filled inside me. Despite the underlying tension, I couldn't help but find the situation amusing. There was something comical about the contrasting personalities and their playful rivalry. One can't help but smile, other is sitting on the chair like a sulking child. While everyone else are talking and sharing opinions. The actors began trying on the chosen outfits, one after the other, swirling around to give us a good look. Sean carefully observed their fits, making minor adjustments here and there. Tweaking one safety pin behind or another on the side. Emma raised her concerns about the length of her dress, while Jake argued that his shirt felt too tight around the collar. There are many more adjustments that is gonna be needed for Sean to complete in a few days. In the midst of their debates, Joseph and Alex chimed in with their opinions. Joseph, ever the advocate for bold choices, insisted, “We need some vibrant shades to bring out the characters' personalities. We have very little time to showcase a story. it will be better if they can use the help of their outfits.” He is not wrong, but that would make them contrasted. We need to follow a color theme. Alex, on the other hand, countered, “I believe pastels and fresh colors are more in line with the current trends. It will give the production a modern touch.” Observing the two men on either side of me, I couldn't help but feel caught in the middle. I carefully considered their opinions before voicing my own. “I think Alex has a point. Pastels would indeed give a refreshing and contemporary vibe to the costumes. And since we are following a summer vibe, I think that should be considered.” A proud smile formed on Alex's lips, while Joseph's irritation was evident. However, before Joseph could express his dissent, his phone rang, and he excused himself to take the call. His sudden departure left an awkward silence in the room. Everyone adjust to the little awkwardness that still remained and started again with the work. Taking advantage of the moment, Alex leaned closer to me, a playful glimmer in his eyes. “Rose, I must say, your taste in fashion aligns perfectly with mine. I'm glad we're on the same page.” I chuckled, feeling a mixture of excitement and confusion. “It seems we have a shared aesthetic, Alex. Let's hope it translates well into the production.” Just as we were conversing, Joseph returned unexpectedly, his eyes narrowing as he witnessed us talking. A surge of anger flashed across his face before he abruptly turned and stormed back to his office, leaving us puzzled. The costume designer, sensing the tension, tried to diffuse the situation. “Well, Rose, Alex, the fittings are almost complete. Overall, I believe the costumes are shaping up wonderfully. The colors and styles complement the characters' personalities perfectly.” I nodded, grateful for the designer's input. “Thank you for your hard work. Please get started with the fittings. We’ll start filming from next week.” As the actors continued changing outfits to their clothes when Alex added, “how about we share contacts, I'll call you soon as my assistant confirm the location?” I hesitated for a moment, glancing around to ensure no prying eyes were watching, before sharing my contact information with him. Our exchange didn't go unnoticed by Joseph, who had returned to the room, his eyes fixed on us. His anger was palpable as he silently observed Alex's demeanor. His reaction perplexed me. I couldn't understand why he was acting so mad, especially considering he had chosen Alex as the director. His sudden withdrawal, retreating to his room for the rest of the discussion only added to my confusion. Despite the underlying tension, I tried to maintain a sense of professionalism. I engaged in discussions with the actors, providing feedback on the costumes and offering encouragement. However, the absence of Joseph's presence weighed heavily on the atmosphere. Done for the day, I couldn't help but feel a mixture of excitement and apprehension for the upcoming production. The dynamic between Alex and Joseph had certainly added an unexpected twist to the process. I could only hope that their differences would ultimately contribute to the success of the project, rather than hinder it. Everyone already went home when I walked into Joseph's office, holding the photographs of the chosen outfits and makeup styles in my hands. His reaction was far from what I expected. He simply nodded and took the photos without saying anything other than, “I'll see it.” Concern etched across my face, I couldn't help but wonder if he was sick. So, I asked, “Joseph, is something wrong? Are you feeling unwell?” He shook his head dismissively. “No, I'm fine. Just a bit preoccupied with work, that's all.” I sighed relief. I've been in the mistake of thinking that I've done something to annoy him. but if it isn’t for me, it must have something to do with Alex. Sensing his distance, I mustered up the courage to extend an invitation. “You know, Joseph, I've been meaning to thank you for everything you've done. How about I take you and Mark out for dinner? It'll be my treat.” He waved his hand, brushing off my offer. “No need to bother. You can go ahead with your plans for the date you've set up with Alex.” His response caught me off guard. Confusion clouded my thoughts as I searched for an explanation. “Joseph, I don't understand. Why are you acting this way? What do you mean by 'the date you’ve set up'? I'm not going on any date.” With mounting frustration, he unleashed his pent-up anger. His words cut through me like a sharp blade. “We are here for work, Rose! Not to indulge in romantic entanglements. Don't you get that? I've begged everyone because I saw potential in you, but for some days I'm seeing you are more occupied with something else.” His outburst left me speechless, my emotions teetering on the edge. I've been working even after leaving office. Still planning everything meticulously. How can his accusatory tone make me feel so disappointed. “Fine! If you are going to do this, I'll better leave you alone.” Unable to bear his accusations any longer, I quietly left his office and retreated to my own. The weight of his words lingered, leaving me with a sense of hurt and confusion. As I closed the door behind me, I sank into my chair, struggling to make sense of Joseph's sudden anger. What had I done to deserve such treatment? I had simply been trying to foster a positive working environment and extend my gratitude for all his help. The room felt suffocating, and I longed for answers. I couldn't help but question why Joseph's frustrations were being directed at me. Had I unknowingly crossed a boundary? The more I pondered, the more frustrated and disheartened I became. Feeling a mix of emotions, I resolved to give Joseph some space, hoping that he would eventually explain his outburst. It was clear that tensions were running high, and I had no desire to exacerbate the situation further. The silence enveloping me, I couldn't shake off the nagging feeling of confusion and disappointment. This unexpected turn of events had cast a shadow over our once harmonious working relationship, leaving me yearning for resolution and understanding. But for the day, I'm going to go home and not think about it anymore.

text: The following are 10 LLM security concerns: LLM01: Prompt Injections: Prompt Injection Vulnerabilities in LLMs involve crafty inputs leading to undetected manipulations. The impact ranges from data exposure to unauthorized actions, serving attacker's goals. LLM02: Insecure Output Handling: These occur when plugins or apps accept LLM output without scrutiny, potentially leading to XSS, CSRF, SSRF, privilege escalation, remote code execution, and can enable agent hijacking attacks. LLM03: Training Data Poisoning: LLMs learn from diverse text but risk training data poisoning, leading to user misinformation. Overreliance on AI is a concern. Key data sources include Common Crawl, WebText, OpenWebText, and books. LLM04: Denial of Service: An attacker interacts with an LLM in a way that is particularly resource-consuming, causing quality of service to degrade for them and other users, or for high resource costs to be incurred. LLM05: Supply Chain: LLM supply chains risk integrity due to vulnerabilities leading to biases, security breaches, or system failures. Issues arise from pre-trained models, crowdsourced data, and plugin extensions. LLM06: Permission Issues: Lack of authorization tracking between plugins can enable indirect prompt injection or malicious plugin usage, leading to privilege escalation, confidentiality loss, and potential remote code execution. LLM07: Data Leakage: Data leakage in LLMs can expose sensitive information or proprietary details, leading to privacy and security breaches. Proper data sanitization, and clear terms of use are crucial for prevention. LLM08: Excessive Agency: When LLMs interface with other systems, unrestricted agency may lead to undesirable operations and actions. Like web-apps, LLMs should not self-police; controls must be embedded in APIs. LLM09: Overreliance: Overreliance on LLMs can lead to misinformation or inappropriate content due to "hallucinations." Without proper oversight, this can result in legal issues and reputational damage. LLM10: Insecure Plugins: Plugins connecting LLMs to external resources can be exploited if they accept free-form text inputs, enabling malicious requests that could lead to undesired behaviors or remote code execution. --- We want to design an RAG system in-house and want to address above. Help me to address each. My systems is like this: An RAG for an internal search system. It is not externally face public only internal employees. Also, the employees do not make any deciiosn based on the out put of searc hsystem. AWS infrastructure is used for this.

text: Refine this essay, emphasizing the family tradition of learning and giving back to society: Talking about why I have become so eager for knowledge and desiring education in the way I am now, it all traces back to my grandfather. My grandfather was born in a rural area, a poor little mountain village that placed great importance on education. The villagers firmly believed that education was the means to change the future. Even if they couldn't afford to eat well, they still made sure to send their children to school. As a result, my grandfather became the first generation of college graduates. Inheriting this mindset, he returned to his hometown and established the "Xingkai Education Foundation," using the same philosophy to nurture my mother. Thanks to this, my mother pursued her education relentlessly and earned a Ph.D. in economics. She stayed at the university, eventually becoming a professor. Growing up in such a family, encouraged by my family and influenced by the atmosphere at home, I have been interested in knowledge and enjoyed learning new things since childhood. This upbringing has fostered my curiosity and a desire to explore, hoping to receive more education to understand the essence of the world as humans comprehend it. My mother is currently a scholar specializing in experimental economics. Under the influence of this type of research, I have developed a strong interest in experimental verification of truths. Many experiments conducted during my courses at the Institute of Technical Physics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, exploring the interference and diffraction of light, have fascinated me. I hope to continue using such methods in the future to further understand the world around us. Embracing this philosophy, I have also become involved in the volunteer translation project of Astronomy Online. As a volunteer, I translate astronomy news from English to Chinese, aiming to enhance the astronomical awareness of those who do not understand English well.

text: Reprhase and explain very thoroughly "I'm confident in saying that I or any of the people I know. Never had any intent or interest in the information being discussed. Any claims that someone gave me a phone to absolute. I repeat absolute fabrication. There's a story I've heard, and it goes that walls have ears too. In other words one had better be careful what one talks about. There is absolutely no logic in anyone claiming to have given me a phone. Because doing so puts not only me but the relevant law enforcement in a tricky situation. If there are such claims they are fabricated for a purpose. I have not had a single conversation with my ex's father. I did not initiate the topic of conversation. And if anyone has a recording of the conversation. You can clearly hear me utter the words "Don't talk about it, I don't trust you." I understand, however, that unfortunately in some people's eyes I look like the person who not only acted haughty with his girlfriend but inadvertently helped create a complicated situation. It is also an absolute lie to claim that the arrest was recruitment. In my opinion, with the technical means available, if anyone ever wanted to take information from anyone it was not me. Also vaccines were not only produced in the west. Any claims that this was a situation that would embarrass only western countries is, in my opinion, absolutely inaccurate. By now you could buy a phone from EE a hundred times and check if in any way those phones were any different to the others. In no way by my actions have I meant to damage the prestige, authority or compromise anyone. I have a degree in business and management, which is tantamount to working in administration."

text: Explain this to me: Introduction API Root Endpoint United States https://www.site24x7.com/api Europe https://www.site24x7.eu/api China https://www.site24x7.cn/api India https://www.site24x7.in/api Australia https://www.site24x7.net.au/api Japan https://app.site24x7.jp/api The Site24x7 API helps you achieve all the operations that can be performed on our web client. The API requires OAuthtoken as an account identifier. This API is built using the REST principles which ensures predictable URLs that make writing applications easy. This API follows HTTP rules, where a wide range of HTTP clients can be used to interact with the API. Every resource is exposed as a URL. The URL of each resource can be obtained by accessing the API Root Endpoint. We have multiple data centers in Site24x7: United States - .com Europe - .eu China - .cn India - .in Australia - .net.au All examples in the document, except Japan, are based on COM domain. You can change the DC Root endpoint of any example from COM to any DC you want to access. For Japan DC, the API Root Endpoint would be https://app.site24x7.jp Getting Started Example $ curl https://www.site24x7.com/api/monitors \ -H 'Accept: application/json; version=2.0' \ -H 'Authorization: Zoho-oauthtoken 1000.41d9f2cfbd1b7a8f9e314b7aff7ab2d1.8fcc9810810a216793f385b9dd6e125f' \ All Site24x7 APIs require a Authorization request header for authentication. Authentication Zoho Accounts Root Endpoint United States https://accounts.zoho.com Europe https://accounts.zoho.eu China https://accounts.zoho.com.cn India https://accounts.zoho.in Australia https://accounts.zoho.com.au Japan https://accounts.zoho.jp Site24x7 REST APIs uses the OAuth 2.0 protocol to authorize and authenticate calls. The OAuth protocol provides a more secure access to protect resources, thereby reducing the hassle of asking for a username and password every time a user logs in. We have multiple data centers in Zoho: United States - .com Europe - .eu China - .com.cn India - .in Australia - .com.au Japan - .jp All examples in PART 1 - 4 are based on COM domain. You can change the DC Root endpoint of any example from COM to any DC you want to access. Please follow the steps below to access Site24x7’s APIs using OAuth 2.0: PART 1: REGISTERING NEW CLIENT APPLICATION Register your application with Site24x7 to get your Client ID and Client Secret. For script-based API calls, the Self Client option in the Zoho Developer Console is preferrable or check out the other options based on your client types. To register your application using the Self Client option, Go to Zoho Developer Console and click on Get Started Now > Self Client > Create Now. United States Europe China India Australia Japan Click on Create. Confirm the process. On successful registration, you will be provided with a set of OAuth 2.0 credentials such as Client ID and Client Secret, that are known to both Zoho and your application. Note: Do not share these credentials to anyone. PART 2: GENERATING GRANT TOKEN Once you have successfully registered the client application, generate a grant token to obtain authorization to use the APIs based on your requirement. If you have generated the OAuth 2.0 credentials using the Self Client option, then please follow the steps below: Go to Zoho Developer Console and click on the created Self Client. Navigate to the Generate Code tab and provide the Scope List of scopes (based on the API calls that you are going to use), Description, and the Time Duration for its validity (from 3 minutes to 10 minutes). Get the scopes for the APIs from their respective API document and separate multiple scopes with commas. Click Generate. Copy the code for the mentioned scope. For other client types (such as web-based), refer here. Note: Generating a Grant Token is a one-time process. It cannot be generated via API call. Once the Grant Token is generated, refer Part 3 to create a Refresh Token immediately before the former expires. Please note that the Refresh Token is permanent and has no expiry. PART 3: GENERATE ACCESS AND REFRESH TOKEN POST https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token?client_id={client_id}&client_secret={client_secret}&code={code}&grant_type=authorization_code After getting the grant token from the above step, make a POST request for the following URL with the given params to generate the access_token: Request Example $ curl https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token \ -X POST \ -d "client_id=1000.0SRSZSY37WMZ69405H3TMYI2239V" \ -d "client_secret=fb0196010f2b70df8db2a173ca2cf59388798abf"\ -d "code=1000.dd7e47321d48b8a7e312e3d6eb1a9bb8.b6c07ac766ec11da98bf6a261e24dca4"\ -d "grant_type=authorization_code" \ Response Example { "access_token":"1000.2deaf8d0c268e3c85daa2a013a843b10.703adef2bb337b 8ca36cfc5d7b83cf24", "refresh_token":"1000.18e983526f0ca8575ea9c53b0cd5bb58.1bd83a6f2e22c3a7e1309d96ae439cc1", "expires_in":3600, "api_domain":"https://www.zohoapis.com", "token_type":"Bearer" } Parameter Description client_id Mandatory Client ID obtained during Client Registration. client_secret Mandatory Client Secret obtained during Client Registration. code Mandatory The grant token that is obtained in the above step. grant_type Mandatory Value must be authorization_code In the response, you will get both access_token and refresh_token. The access_token will expire after some specified seconds (represented by expires_in param in the response). You can regenerate a new access_token using the refresh_token (Refer Part 5: Generate Access Token from Refresh Token). The refresh_token is permanent. To revoke a refresh_token, refer Part 6: Revoking a Refresh Token. Note: Each time a re-consent page is accepted, a new refresh token is generated. The maximum limit is 20 refresh tokens per user. If this limit is crossed, the first refresh token is automatically deleted to accommodate the latest one. This is done irrespective of whether the first refresh token is in use or not. You can generate a maximum of 20 refresh tokens in a span of 10 minutes per client ID. Each refresh token can have a maximum of 10 active access tokens (non expired). When the user creates the 11th access token, the first created access token is automatically deleted to accommodate the latest one. You can also refer to sample scripts in the community post. Read the kbase article to know about the common OAuth Errors. PART 4: CALLING AN API Once the access and the refresh tokens are generated, API calls can be made by passing the access token in the header. Header name should be Authorization Header value should be Zoho-oauthtoken {access_token} To access an MSP Customer or a BU’s data you need to pass their ZAAID in the header. For more information. Header name should be Cookie Header value should be zaaid={zaaid of the customer/bu} Note: Access tokens cannot be passed in the request param. Example $ curl https://www.site24x7.com/api/monitors \ -H 'Authorization: Zoho-oauthtoken 1000.41d9f2cfbd1b7a8f9e314b7aff7ab2d1.8fcc9810810a216793f385b9dd6e125f' \ List of scopes available in Site24x7: Scope Description account To access, add, edit, delete users and license related data. Availabe types: Site24x7.Account.Read, Site24x7.Account.Create, Site24x7.Account.Update, Site24x7.Account.Delete, Site24x7.Account.All admin To access, add, edit, delete monitors, configuration profiles, third party integrations etc. Availabe types: Site24x7.Admin.Read, Site24x7.Admin.Create, Site24x7.Admin.Update, Site24x7.Admin.Delete, Site24x7.Admin.All reports To access, add, edit, delete reports and monitor status. Availabe types: Site24x7.Reports.Read, Site24x7.Reports.Create, Site24x7.Reports.Update, Site24x7.Reports.Delete, Site24x7.Reports.All operations To access, add, edit, delete operation related data such as IT Automation, maintenance, status page announcements etc. Availabe types: Site24x7.Operations.Read, Site24x7.Operations.Create, Site24x7.Operations.Update, Site24x7.Operations.Delete, Site24x7.Operations.All msp To access, add, edit, delete MSP related data. Availabe types: Site24x7.Msp.Read, Site24x7.Msp.Create, Site24x7.Msp.Update, Site24x7.Msp.Delete, Site24x7.Msp.All bu To access, add, edit, delete Business Units related data. Availabe types: Site24x7.Bu.Read, Site24x7.Bu.Create, Site24x7.Bu.Update, Site24x7.Bu.Delete, Site24x7.Bu.All PART 5: GENERATE ACCESS TOKEN FROM REFRESH TOKEN POST https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token?client_id={client_id}&client_secret={client_secret}&refresh_token={refresh_token}&grant_type=refresh_token Access tokens have limited validity. In most of the cases, the access tokens expire in one hour. Until then, the access token has unlimited usage. Once it expires, your app will have to use the refresh token to request for a new access token. Note: You can generate a maximum of 10 access tokens in a span of 10 minutes. Make the following POST request with the given params to get a new access token: Request Example $ curl https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token \ -X POST \ -d "client_id=1000.0SRSZSY37WMZ69405H3TMYI2239V" \ -d "client_secret=fb0196010f2b70df8db2a173ca2cf59388798abf" \ -d "refresh_token=1000.8ecd474019e31d52d2f94aad6c5cb7.4638677ebc14f2f2ee0b6dfb6cebdc"\ -d "grant_type=refresh_token" \ Response Example { "access_token":"1000.2deaf8d0c268e3c85daa2a013a843b10.703adef2bb337b 8ca36cfc5d7b83cf24", "expires_in":3600, "api_domain":"https://www.zohoapis.com", "token_type":"Bearer" } Parameter Description client_id Mandatory Client ID obtained during Client Registration. client_secret Mandatory Client Secret obtained during Client Registration. refresh_token Mandatory REFRESH TOKEN using which a new access token has to be generated. grant_type Mandatory Value must be refresh_token.

Availabe types: Site24x7.Reports.Read, Site24x7.Reports.Create, Site24x7.Reports.Update, Site24x7.Reports.Delete, Site24x7.Reports.All operations To access, add, edit, delete operation related data such as IT Automation, maintenance, status page announcements etc. Availabe types: Site24x7.Operations.Read, Site24x7.Operations.Create, Site24x7.Operations.Update, Site24x7.Operations.Delete, Site24x7.Operations.All msp To access, add, edit, delete MSP related data. Availabe types: Site24x7.Bu.Read, Site24x7.Bu.Create, Site24x7.Bu.Update, Site24x7.Bu.Delete, Site24x7.Bu.All PART 5: GENERATE ACCESS TOKEN FROM REFRESH TOKEN POST https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token?client_id={client_id}&client_secret={client_secret}&refresh_token={refresh_token}&grant_type=refresh_token Access tokens have limited validity. In most of the cases, the access tokens expire in one hour. Until then, the access token has unlimited usage. Once it expires, your app will have to use the refresh token to request for a new access token. Note: You can generate a maximum of 10 access tokens in a span of 10 minutes. Make the following POST request with the given params to get a new access token: Request Example $ curl https://accounts.zoho.com/oauth/v2/token \ -X POST \ -d "client_id=1000.0SRSZSY37WMZ69405H3TMYI2239V" \ -d "client_secret=fb0196010f2b70df8db2a173ca2cf59388798abf" \ -d "refresh_token=1000.8ecd474019e31d52d2f94aad6c5cb7.4638677ebc14f2f2ee0b6dfb6cebdc"\ -d "grant_type=refresh_token" \ Response Example { "access_token":"1000.2deaf8d0c268e3c85daa2a013a843b10.703adef2bb337b 8ca36cfc5d7b83cf24", "expires_in":3600, "api_domain":"https://www.zohoapis.com", "token_type":"Bearer" } Parameter Description client_id Mandatory Client ID obtained during Client Registration. client_secret Mandatory Client Secret obtained during Client Registration. refresh_token Mandatory REFRESH TOKEN using which a new access token has to be generated. grant_type Mandatory Value must be refresh_token.

text: Chat GPT could you summarize the following text into 100 words? Coastal restoration and rehabilitation offer great promise for vulnerable and marginalized groups in need of adaptation. However in Kenya, a critical research gap in evidence-based policy discussions demands immediate attention to advance these efforts towards building resilience for the most vulnerable segments of society. Presently, there is a lack of a dedicated community-led framework and relevant indicators that can effectively align coastal restoration and rehabilitation initiatives with the priorities of different social groups, especially those who are vulnerable and marginalized, such as women, children, indigenous communities, persons with disabilities, and minorities, all residing within the coastal regions. Additionally, there is a pressing need to establish methods for measuring and reporting the effectiveness of these restoration and rehabilitation efforts in addressing the intersectional vulnerabilities within these communities. Furthermore, linking the lessons learned from these initiatives to national adaptation plans and NDCs (Nationally Determined Contributions) is essential for ensuring a comprehensive approach to coastal resilience and safeguarding the interests of the vulnerable populations. The project aims to co-create locally led restoration indicators with the established community of practices and all the stakeholders through development of evidence based policy labs. Our project main goals: 1. To map out all stakeholders and establish a community of practice in coastal conservation and restoration. 2. To assess Policy, Institutional Framework and Knowledge gaps on coastal ecosystem restoration initiatives. 3. To assess the locally led restoration activities undertaken by different community groups. 4. To work with different local community groups to co-develop and agree on indicators that capture priority restoration actions and their expectations of impacts based on the assessed gaps 5. Co-development of impact learning and conservation framework: Based on the assessments, we will develop learning materials on restoration and conservation of coastal ecosystems and a conservation framework that targets the specific needs of coastal communities. 6. Establishment of multi stakeholder policy labs that will target all stakeholders and community of practice implementing restoration programs. These will be trained on Locally led restoration metrics co-production and development

text: 1. Position Information Title: Consultancy for supporting Karnali PA for Public Hearing, Oversight, and Promoting Open Parliamentary Practices Department/Unit: Parliament Support Project Reports to: National Project Manager Coordination with: Project Team Lead Implementation Area: Provincial Assembly Expected Places of Travel (if applicable): NA Duration of Assignment: 01 June to 30 August Provision of support services: Office space Yes □ No x Equipment (laptop etc.) Yes □ No x Secretarial Services Yes □ No x 2. Background Information Since 2018, UNDP through parliament support (PSP) project is supporting the parliaments and secretariats in PAs to strengthen their capacities for effective operation of parliamentary functions including institutional capacity building. PSP’s support to the PAs are focused primarily towards strengthening parliamentary core functions; oversight, law making, and enhancing the representation. PSP, over the years has invested in the parliament outreach and openness through various initiation such as: introducing Meet the Speaker in Karnali and Sudurpaschim Provinces, connecting the PAs with the District through virtual mode, development of Outreach plan of action, supporting the parliaments for the public hearing through the media and CSOs to count few. Some of the initiations of previous years have been adopted by the PA secretariats in some ways however, there are still many areas where the Parliament secretariat has limited engagement such as engaging with the public and thematic independent CSOs in the oversight of pertinent issues. Though there are examples of some openness activities initiated by the PA secretariat, but these are not always consistent. Likewise, the engagement with the citizens through public hearing and open interaction is another aspect through which the parliament Secretariat can enhance their outreach and openness where the secretariat will get the opportunities to respond to the queries from the citizen while sharing about the activities of the Parliament secretariat. Planning and organizing an event where citizen forums could be engaged through the consultation, dialogues, sharing, and other side activities could be another method of promoting parliament openness by engaging with the public, youth, and students in larger scale. Additionally, engaging with the CSOs for supporting the parliament secretariat in planning and organizing the events related to the parliamentary openness not only help the secretariat in swift management but it will also contribute towards wider stakeholder engagement in the parliamentary affairs and better understanding and awareness on the overall legislative development and oversight mechanism. In this backdrop, PSP plans to engage with a competent service provider organization to support the Karnali PA secretariat in the oversight on relevant emerging issues, including the public hearing and a mega event on the parliamentary openness. Through these programs the PA secretariats are expected to enhance their collaboration with the relevant CSOs and experts while also inspiring the PA towards making the parliament more open and accessible to the public. Thus the project plans to hire service from a consulting firm/organisation that can provide the service as per the scope of this ToR. 3. Objectives of Assignment The overall objective of the proposed assignment is: To conduct dialogues/interaction through public hearing to make parliament accountable to the citizens To support the PA committees in their oversight works to engage with relevant thematic CSOs. To support the PA secretariat in planning and organizing a package event as part of the parliamentary openness 4. Scope of work Expected Results/Deliverables/Final Products Expected The service provider will work in close coordination with the Project to complete the following duties and responsibilities. Scope of Work: The service provider will establish coordination with the PSP, PA secretariat and relevant stakeholders to to facilitate the said activities relating to conducting 2 public hearing, 2 events with Committees on their oversight work, and conduct one package-based Event for Parliamentary Openness in Karnali Province. In addition, the service provider will accomplish the following: Planning and Implementation Activity1: Support PA to Conduct Public Hearing-2 events Service provider will identify key issues and develop a plan for the public hearing Coordinate with the PA secretariat, relevant thematic committees for planning and organization Identify the key issues and venue for public hearing with the Committee on various issues within its jurisdiction, and it will be done in consultation with the Committee secretariat and PSP. Collect pertinent questions and concerns form the selected community on the issue in advance so that it could be raised during the hearing programme. Research some evidence on the key issues of the community so that the moderator could help the community raise/complement their concerns. Select the Chairs/MPs (at least 4) representing at least 2 thematic committees of the PA and at least one MP from that constituency. Select a spot related to selected issues that must be accessible and feasible for a one-day event. Organize and facilitate2 events of public hearing program between the parliamentarians of the PA of the Province and the citizens on the selected issue. The interaction will take place at the community level which is accessible in terms of proximity from the provincial capital. Make sure that media persons are also engaged in the event and the news of the same is covered by the local media. Prepare a detailed report with the major issues raised, response/commitment made, and ways forward. Activity 2: Support PA secretariat to engage with Research institutions and CSOs in oversight work-2 events Service provider will prepare plan of engagement with the CSOs Coordination with PA Secretariat, committees and relevant CSOs for the engagement in committees works Conduct a half day interaction/ sharing event among the PA secretariat, Committees and lead representative from the CSOs to inform the committees on their thematic areas of engagement, and sensitize to identify the pertinent areas for the oversight. Facilitate evidence-based presentations from the CSOs so that committees could make informed choices about their oversight agenda. Such engagement could be with different committees such as women and social dev committees with focus on women and social justice, Public Accounts Committee with CSOs and media active on public financial governance , Agriculture and Environment committee with the CSOs working on Environment, Climate and forestry etc.) Document the major discussion, way forward and future engagement plan, if any Provide the committees with the roster of the CSOs/research institutions for the use of the committees Activity 3: Support PA secretariat to promote open parliamentary practices-1 packaged event Service provider will develop an event plan to organize the event for promoting the parliamentary openness. Coordinate and share with the Parliament Secretariat, leadership, and PSP the event plan and finalizee event accordingly. The public hearing program will be more participative, interactive, and practical where all the stakeholders will be given the chance to share their queries unopposed. The moderation of the public hearing program will be managed by a moderator to bind the program in a standard format and save the time The event on the engagement with the CSOs/Research Institutions will be expert led for the better understanding of Parliamentarians followed by a moderated open discussion. The eservice provider must mobilize an independent expert with exemplary expertise and experience in parliamentary affairs, oversight issues and collaboration who can share his/her findings without any prejudice. The parliament openness event will be planned based on the discussion and agreement with the PA secretariat and in consultation with PSP. The service provider will ensure all public communication via relevant media to invite the public and engage the partners such as university and media, and disseminate the programme and so on. The service provider must document all the events and its output/outcome appropriately along with the report, pictures, and videos. The service provider should have to be flexible enough to plan the events as per the availability of the Parliament and Committee leadership The service provider team /moderator should avoid any issues/ discussion that may cause political conflict during the events. The service provider must ensure the Gender balanced participation in each event. Report Submission Prepare and submit the event completion report with a precise Executive summary followed by activity wise chapters (1 chapter for Public hearing, one for Engagement with the CSOs in Oversight, and one on Openness event) . The Report will include key achievements and observations, points of discussion, key anecdotes/remarks of the participants, parliamentarians, lessons learnt, ways forward, and necessary annexes relating thereof to UNDP/PSP. Time Frame: The time frame for the completion of the assignment is within 01 June 30 August 2023 Expected Results/Final Products/Deliverables: Completion of 2 public hearing events on key issue with the parliament and Committee leadership in the Karnali Province where at least 100 public (including some from LGBTIQ and Persons with Disabilities groups) interact with the committee leadership. Completion of 2 events with the CSOs/Research Institution on parliamentary Oversight where 10 -15 thematic CSOs will get the opportunity to discuss about the issues with Committee leadership as stated above. Completion of 1 packaged event on promoting the parliamentary openness where at least 250 public get the opportunity to directly participate and reach out to at least 10 thousand people via social media tools A report based on the findings and outcomes of these 3 events and possible ways forward. Good photos and a small (2-3minutes) video featuring the summary of all three events and feedbacks of the participants. Make two different bids ( Two different organization) for this TOR

text: Due to their hydrophobic nature, pentacyclic triterpenoids are almost insoluble in water. They are classified in the biopharmaceutical classification system as class IV drugs as their pharmacological effects are limited due to their low solubility in water and potential difficulty in permeating biological membranes [78]. For these reasons, some new approaches have been introduced to enhance their biopharmaceutical properties, particularly drug delivery technologies. At present, nano-emulsions, mesoporous silica nanoparticles, solid lipid nanoparticles, liposomes, niossomal gels and solid dispersions have been proposed quite successfully [79]; however, most of these studies were performed in experimental animals, and research in humans is very scarce, despite the great therapeutic potential of these natural biocompounds. Table 1 summarizes the current knowledge of OA pharmacokinetics in humans after oral single-dose administration. Song et al. [80] reported the results of a pharmacokinetic study performed with 18 healthy male Chinese volunteers, in which the participants received a single dose of 40 mg OA (capsule preparation). Venous blood samples were collected for 48 h, and the plasma was analyzed for OA contents. The area under the plasma OA concentration–time curve (AUC) was determined in 124.3 ± 106.7 ng h/mL, with a peak OA concentration of 12.1 ± 6.8 ng/mL, which was registered at 5.2 ± 2.9 h after the OA intake. Later on, a randomized, crossover and self-control study was carried out with 18 healthy Chinese male volunteers, who received 20 mg OA orally, formulated as normal tablets and dispersible tablets [81]. The resulting pharmacokinetic parameters included AUC values of 112.2 ± 56.6 and 109.7 ± 41.6 ng h/mL, for normal and dispersible tablets, respectively, and OA peak concentrations of 18.9 ± 8.0 and 17.8 ± 7.5 ng/mL, which were recorded at 2.9 ± 1.2 and 2.5 ± 1.0 h after the triterpene administration. In 2015, Rada et al. informed on a pharmacokinetic study developed with nine adult men, who were administered 30 mg OA dissolved in 70 g of pomace olive oil. The reported AUC value was 3181.9 ± 894.3 ng h/mL, with an OA maximum concentration of 598.2 ± 176.7 ng/mL, achieved at 3.0 ± 0.8 h after the intake of the OA-containing oil. The administered OA dose revealed a distribution volume of 81.4 ± 9.7 L, and removal half-lives of 4.6 ± 1.1 h. The 30 mg OA oral dose yielded a total clearance of 35.1 ± 4.2 L/h [82]. More recently, de la Torre et al. [83] reported that an administration of 4.7 mg of OA within 30 mL of olive oil to 12 individuals led to a maximum concentration of 5.1 ± 2.1 ng/mL in plasma 4 h after the intake.

text: Story prompt: 13-year-old Max was headed to a friend’s house. As someone who can’t drive yet, he uses a ride-sharing app to get from one place to another. On this day, however, he ended up sharing a ride with a stranger. 13 years old as well, she was dressed fashionably and had an air of popularity to her. Someone who definitely went out with friends more often than others. According to the app, her destination was a large shopping mall, closer than Max’s friend’s house, thought pretty far away. It would take about 30 minutes to get to the mall. In the meantime, Max, who was never one to initiate conversation, kept to himself. Still, 30 minutes was gonna take a while. “So… mall, huh?”, awkwardly asked Max to start a conversation. “Yeah.”, was the response she gave him. Doesn’t seem like she was interested. Why would she? Everyone’s a stranger in the car. This was gonna be a long ride. Still, it didn’t seem like she was completely cold and distant. After a few minutes had passed, Max opened up with, “Hanging out with a friend today. Thinking you’re doing the same?” The girl responded, “Yeah. Probably just gonna go window shopping.”, while on her phone. “Got any other plans after that?”, asked Max. Even she was surprised to answer him so casually, saying, “We got basketball practice today at 4.” Max replied, “Oh, cool. I had a feeling you were the sporty type too.” It didn’t take long for the seemingly awkward boy and the seemingly disinterested girl to actually engage in long conversations. It didn’t even register to them that they were already at the mall. “I’m Max, by the way.” The girl replied, “My name’s Suzanna. Or Suzie, but whatever. It was nice talkin’ to you, Max.”, just before closing the door and going inside the mall. As the car began to head to his friend’s house, Max couldn’t help but think to himself, “I just had a good conversation with a stranger. Pretty, too.”

text: Please re write this technology newsletter to make it read better. The audience is prospective technology candidates who we'd like to come and work at our company: Welcome to the latest version of the CommBank Technology Newsletter. As a member of our Talent Community this newsletter is your exclusive insight into news, events and happenings across CommBank Technology teams. We're expanding our Gen AI partnership with Microsoft We will work with Microsoft to drive greater customer benefits through wider adoption of generative AI (Gen AI) and ongoing cyber security initiatives. Key elements of the partnership include delivering: • Superior customer experiences – including developing a CommBank Copilot to resolve customer queries faster and help customers better understand their money; • Customer safety – sharing intelligence to enhance cyber security and developing tools for CBA business customers to help them better protect themselves; • Sovereign capability – working together to develop cyber skills capability to help Australia keep pace globally on artificial intelligence; • People experience – developing Copilots to help team members use Generative AI to better respond to customer needs; • Engineering excellence – increasing collaboration between engineering teams through AI to share knowledge and solutions to deliver more for customers. We hosted our first post Covid meet-up! The event included a panel discussion on the hot topic of generative AI. Our expert panel explored: ◾ The implementation of generative AI at scale ◾ Creating personalised customer experiences ◾ Scaling trusted AI for growth and productivity We rolled out our industry leading NameCheck technology to other major financial institutions Bendigo Bank and fraud monitoring company Satori, are each looking to pilot our industry leading NameCheck technology in a bid to further protect Australians from scams and mistaken payments. Since its launch in March this year, the technology has prevented more than 10,000 scam payments which would have totalled in excess of an estimated $38 million and already reduced mistaken payments by more than $100 million We launched an AWS 'CloudUp for Her' skills development program With 1200 women registering to take part in the first course it was the largest cohort that AWS has seen in the APAC region for a similar program. The course is open to all women employed within CommBank and it doesn't require any technology skills. It will help us tackle the technology talent shortage particularly amongst females by investing in skills for the future.

text: In 2016, the City of Sontse, Florida, installed porcelain tile in 45 of the neighborhood community centers in the city. City managers wanted to upgrade the facilities' quality to rent them out for private functions. Designers working on the renovations selected Porcelain tile manufactured by Anato Porcelain for all floors because of its upscale appearance, durability, and slip-resistant properties. However, city leaders were concerned about users slipping on these floors due to the likelihood of wet floors from spills, plumbing issues, and water blowing in during heavy rainfall. Because of this, designers required that the new porcelain tile floors meet the American National Standards Institute ANSI B101.3 test method for measuring the wet dynamic coefficient of friction (DCOF) of Hard Surface Walkways. This test requires the floor to meet a dynamic coefficient of friction measurement equal to or greater than 0.42 under prescribed wet testing conditions. The quantity of tile ordered from Anato required a 5% overage on the tile needed for the initial installation to be delivered to each location as part of the installation process. This overage was stored at each location to be available for replacement of porcelain that might be needed over the life of the installation. The tiles for the testing were taken from these boxes so that there would be no chance of sealer or cleaning chemicals being on them. However, since installers completed the new porcelain flooring installation, slip-and-fall accidents in these community centers have increased substantially. A report on the local news made residents aware of the extent of the problem, prompting the city to sue Anato Porcelain, claiming the porcelain tile manufacturer provided does not meet the required standard for slip resistance. They are requesting that the manufacturer provide new porcelain tile, pay for testing it before installation, and pay for removal and reinstallation of the new porcelain tile. The manufacturer claims their product did meet the test standards, suggesting that the installers’ application of unapproved sealers or maintenance staff using incorrect cleaning materials post-installation can also cause the problem. The judge overseeing the case had an independent investigation company, Floor Testing Inc., measure a sample from the extra tiles for each community center to evaluate the claim. You have also been hired as an independent expert witness to evaluate if the porcelain tile provided by the manufacturer likely met or failed to meet the required standard. Your contract is for services as an ordinary fact witness. You will report the result of your data analysis with 95% confidence in a memorandum to the judge, who will provide it to the jury hearing the case. You will provide your findings in a memorandum addressed to the judge, Tanya Wasilew, and copied to the Clerk of the Court, Daniel Taft, defense attorney, Mitch Soldano, and the plaintiffs' attorney Amira Herana. Memorandum Headers To and CC lines – The 'To" and "CC" lines content are provided on the template From – Use your full name, your title/role in this assignment. Date – formatted as shown in the example. Re – The reference line needs a short title to identify the specific purpose of the document. As this is a document involved in a legal case, it must start with the case, which includes who is bringing it v. who the case is against (e.g., Brown v. Board of Education), then a brief description of the specific contribution of the document to the case. Introduction Why this document is important for the readers’ goals - Start with a statement of the larger objective with which everyone reading the memorandum can agree. Households and private medium and small businesses did not want to freeze. For the first time this heating season, Germany was unable to keep gas consumption at a level below the pre-crisis five-year plan by 15%. According to Klaus Mueller, head of the Federal Grid Agency, in comparison with the average consumption in 2018-2021, the demand for gas on November 20-26 was only 13% lower. Traditionally, households and small businesses have set the tone. Their level of consumption reduction did not rise above 12%, demand increased to almost 153 million cubic meters per day. This is above the level of the same week last year. In the second half of November, cold weather came to Germany and, obviously, households did not save on heat. According to GIE, gas extraction from German storage facilities exceeded 45 million cubic meters per day, and on November 22 jumped to 80 million cubic meters. In December, fuel extraction increased even higher — to 179 million cubic meters. But the German regulator has not yet published more recent consumption data. What helps Germany save gas is industry. In the penultimate week of November, its consumption was 14% lower than in the pre-crisis five-year period. According to Klaus Mueller, Germany has made sufficient gas reserves for the winter. However, the price of fuel, even in the region of $ 400-$ 500 per thousand cubic meters, is too high for the German economy. In 2018-2021, it amounted to $180 at German hubs. "Europe's residual problem is that it has replaced relatively cheap Russian pipeline gas with relatively expensive LNG, jeopardizing its industrial competitiveness, but this is already a chronic problem, not a crisis," Reuters recently wrote.].

text: rewrite this essay in the style of Harmonie Korine, Hello all, just a quick note on me and my AI journey. It all began in the fall of 2022 when a friend (shout out to the homey Chris) alerted me to this new magical AI application called Midjourney. It would blow me away he told me, allow me to create my own illustrations of whatever my mind could conjure, in whatever style I could imagine. That one conversation took me down an AI art rabbit hole I have yet to emerge from! Since then I have used AI applications (Kaiber, Moonvalley, Pika, Runway, Play HT, DiD, along with my Adobe Suite and self taught design skills) to create everything from Murals, to Comic Books, 100's of T-Shirt Designs, Music Videos, Flyers, Animated Shorts, Animated Sequences for Documentaries and TV Shows, Graphics, Interstitials, tons of Social Media Content and more. In addition I have taught what I've learned in classes with youth and adults on the Caribbean island of Montserrat and at the University of North Florida. While I've covered wide areas of AI usage in art, video and sound, the one area that I had yet to enter successfully was the utilization of AI to write a script. I had attempted this a year ago when the tech wasn't quite ready and I didn't have a technique. I was writing a spec script on the life of John and Alice Coltrane. I asked AI to write me a scene featuring John and Alice Coltrane having an argument about his drug use in their kitchen. The AI ended up interpreting the "John" in my prompt as "John Travolta" and the "Alice" as "Alice in Wonderland". 5 pages of this junk. While interesting on the face of it, greatly frustrating and time wasting. This is what is called a "hallucination", when an AI model generates incorrect information but presents it as if it were a fact. Being as how I was writing a historical script, facts were invaluable to the process. So needless to say, I abandoned that potential boondoggle. But something was about to change. On a whim one month ago, I decided to apply for a potentially life changing opportunity. It is a grant for Latino writers who had a show concept in the drama genre featuring a Latino lead. 6 people are chosen to receive it and the winners get to pitch their show ideas before professional show runners and a big network. I found about about this with one week left before the application window was closing so I quickly got to work. Luckily I had written an entire Bible (a reference document used by screenwriters for information on characters, settings, and other elements of a film project) for a show idea 3 years ago that genre wise fit this contest well enough. It is called "Electro Is Dead" and without getting too deep into the plot basically, it is "The summer of 1988 in Venice Beach, CA. Dennis Juarez aka DJ Rey, Afro-Chicano teen Electro DJ, becomes enmeshed into a dark plot to bring about Hell on Earth."

text: The following are 10 LLM security concerns: LLM01: Prompt Injections: Prompt Injection Vulnerabilities in LLMs involve crafty inputs leading to undetected manipulations. The impact ranges from data exposure to unauthorized actions, serving attacker's goals. LLM02: Insecure Output Handling: These occur when plugins or apps accept LLM output without scrutiny, potentially leading to XSS, CSRF, SSRF, privilege escalation, remote code execution, and can enable agent hijacking attacks. LLM03: Training Data Poisoning: LLMs learn from diverse text but risk training data poisoning, leading to user misinformation. Overreliance on AI is a concern. Key data sources include Common Crawl, WebText, OpenWebText, and books. LLM04: Denial of Service: An attacker interacts with an LLM in a way that is particularly resource-consuming, causing quality of service to degrade for them and other users, or for high resource costs to be incurred. LLM05: Supply Chain: LLM supply chains risk integrity due to vulnerabilities leading to biases, security breaches, or system failures. Issues arise from pre-trained models, crowdsourced data, and plugin extensions. LLM06: Permission Issues: Lack of authorization tracking between plugins can enable indirect prompt injection or malicious plugin usage, leading to privilege escalation, confidentiality loss, and potential remote code execution. LLM07: Data Leakage: Data leakage in LLMs can expose sensitive information or proprietary details, leading to privacy and security breaches. Proper data sanitization, and clear terms of use are crucial for prevention. LLM08: Excessive Agency: When LLMs interface with other systems, unrestricted agency may lead to undesirable operations and actions. Like web-apps, LLMs should not self-police; controls must be embedded in APIs. LLM09: Overreliance: Overreliance on LLMs can lead to misinformation or inappropriate content due to "hallucinations." Without proper oversight, this can result in legal issues and reputational damage. LLM10: Insecure Plugins: Plugins connecting LLMs to external resources can be exploited if they accept free-form text inputs, enabling malicious requests that could lead to undesired behaviors or remote code execution. --- We want to design an RAG system in-house and want to address above. masked_text: The following are 10 LLM security concerns: LLM01: Prompt Injections: Prompt Injection Vulnerabilities in LLMs involve crafty inputs leading to undetected manipulations. The impact ranges from data exposure to unauthorized actions, serving attacker's goals. LLM02: Insecure Output Handling: These occur when plugins or apps accept LLM output without scrutiny, potentially leading to XSS, CSRF, SSRF, privilege escalation, remote code execution, and can enable agent hijacking attacks. LLM03: Training Data Poisoning: LLMs learn from diverse text but risk training data poisoning, leading to user misinformation. Overreliance on AI is a concern. Key data sources include Common Crawl, WebText, OpenWebText, and books. LLM04: Denial of Service: An attacker interacts with an LLM in a way that is particularly resource-consuming, causing quality of service to degrade for them and other users, or for high resource costs to be incurred. LLM05: Supply Chain: LLM supply chains risk integrity due to vulnerabilities leading to biases, security breaches, or system failures. Issues arise from pre-trained models, crowdsourced data, and plugin extensions. LLM06: Permission Issues: Lack of authorization tracking between plugins can enable indirect prompt injection or malicious plugin usage, leading to privilege escalation, confidentiality loss, and potential remote code execution. LLM07: Data Leakage: Data leakage in LLMs can expose sensitive information or proprietary details, leading to privacy and security breaches. Proper data sanitization, and clear terms of use are crucial for prevention. LLM08: Excessive Agency: When LLMs interface with other systems, unrestricted agency may lead to undesirable operations and actions. Like web-apps, LLMs should not self-police; controls must be embedded in APIs. LLM09: Overreliance: Overreliance on LLMs can lead to misinformation or inappropriate content due to "hallucinations." Without proper oversight, this can result in legal issues and reputational damage. LLM10: Insecure Plugins: Plugins connecting LLMs to external resources can be exploited if they accept free-form text inputs, enabling malicious requests that could lead to undesired behaviors or remote code execution. --- We want to design an RAG system in-house and want to address above. text: Build me a corporate and professional revenue model for Msitu Africa, one that has impact and profit.Msitu Africa Carbon Alliance is a profit organization headquartered in Kenya, Africa, where “Msitu” resonates with the Swahili term for “forest.” Our organization is driven by cutting-edge technology and dedicated to the paramount mission of assisting businesses in effectively mitigating their carbon footprint by championing nature-based decarbonization such as carbon farming and tree planting projects across Kenya and the broader African landscape. At the heart of our transformative approach lies an innovative API system, meticulously engineered to automate and optimize Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) as well as Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) procedures. This groundbreaking system seamlessly connects corporate contributions and commitments with the vital carbon offset projects (carbon farming and tree planting initiatives). Through these invaluable donations, we extend comprehensive carbon farming training and expert guidance to local farmers, empowering them to not only bolster their agricultural yields but also to harness revenue opportunities stemming from sequestered carbon credits.

text: Write a 250-word introduction for the following essay: Change Proposal #1: Foster Personal Connections to HHV Health and Human Values is a minor that aims to foster growth of individuals as they pursue careers in health and health care. It prompts students to reflect on issues related to health with an interdisciplinary lens and think about how they can make an impact now and in the future. HHV is not intended to purely be a stepping stone to medical school or graduate school. However, some students state that they are in HHV because it will look good on their resume. In addition, many students express frustration with the assignments in HNRS 250 and do not understand how the readings and reflections connect to their journey in the minor. Another challenge is that sometimes students may conform to the values expressed by Dr. Braitberg or other professors rather than articulating their own opinion. We suggest that HHV make changes that prompt students to develop personal connections to their work in the minor. One change to foster personal connections is to integrate group values into HHV starting in the HNRS 250 class. Group values are a set of beliefs held by a group of people that inform their actions as they work together. By creating group values among each cohort and HHV as a whole, students will feel that their work in HHV is more meaningful to them and will be more invested in the program. Establishing group agreements as students begin HNRS 250 is a great way to start integrating group values in HHV. Group agreements are a set of rules agreed to by the group to create a learning environment in which students are comfortable and enthusiastic engaging in. Examples of group agreements in PATH are Listen Actively, Build the Change, and Uphold Confidentiality. Dr. Braitberg, Dr. Oberman, or other professors teaching HNRS 250 should first prompt students to reflect on what their personal values are which could include Integrity, Justice, and Health. Students can then have discussions about their individual values as a class and make connections with the values of the group and the minor. Then, the professors should have the students brainstorm group agreements that integrate group values. A challenge to this exercise may be that students will be reluctant to participate, especially as underclassmen. The professors can initiate the discussion and make connections between the values of students, but they should be careful not to dominate the activity. These group agreements should be practiced throughout HNRS 250. In addition, there should be more assignments and readings in HNRS 250, the capstone, and internship that require students to reflect on their individual and group values and how they relate to issues in health and healthcare. If students find their own values integrated more in HHV, they will be more invested and engaged as well as find value in the program beyond being a stepping stone. Change Proposal #2: Create More Experiential Learning Opportunities in the Minor The HHV minor places a focus on understanding the social, ethical, cultural, political, and structural factors shape health, disease, and health care. Such an understanding, especially that of an interdisciplinary nature, requires students to be able to critically think about different social issues related to health care. However, one of the concerns with regard to the HHV minor is that there is less student engagement, and one of the reasons for this decreased engagement may be that students sometimes may struggle to understand how the content they are learning in their HHV classes applies directly to their future careers or the communities, institutions, and other settings they are part of in the real-world. Such confusion or lack of understanding can also decrease student engagement. One of the ways to foster critical thinking as well as increase student engagement is through creating more experiential learning opportunities in the minor. Students really value the opportunity to speak with people from different community organizations that address different issues like poverty, homelessness, disability justice, etc that are discussed in the HHV classes. Having an opportunity to speak to more guest speakers can enable students to more clearly see how the content they discuss in class can be applied to the real-world and thus engage with the minor and peers more often. Through experiential learning opportunities such as volunteering and service learning, students will also have the chance to interact with different people and communities that experience the social and health issues discussed in class. This will increase students’ empathy and understanding as well as foster a passion for justice and creating change. Ultimately, experiential learning can increase students’ feelings of citizenship in the minor and ability to think about creating organic change within their own communities. Additionally, students may sometimes feel overwhelmed with too many readings and the same class structure for every class, which can also lead to decreased engagement. One way to potentially address this issue is to prioritize quality over quantity. For instance, organizing field trips to different community organizations (especially for the 250 class) in place of some regular class readings and discussions can allow students to engage with class content in a different learning environment, which can also help increase engagement and allow for a deeper understanding and connection to course material. Furthermore, creating opportunities for meaningful reflections after such experiences can enable students to reflect on their personal growth and consider numerous other career opportunities both in and outside of healthcare to address the issues they are most passionate about. Change Proposal #3: Improve Organization and Structure of HHV Classes We would like to propose an increase in overall structure and organization of the Health and Human Values classes. Establishing a clear structure that is well organized gives students peace of mind and helps them succeed academically. An essential part of any relationship is setting clear expectations of each party. In the context of a student-teacher relationship, a teacher needs to establish their expectations of the student for their class. We would recommend that a syllabus is established by the first day of class. This way, the student is able to fully understand what is expected of them from the beginning. The student can plan accordingly and ensure that the class is the right fit for them and their schedule. We also recommend that the syllabus remain relatively consistent throughout the semester and within cohorts. This would provide students with a sense of stability in addition to clear expectations. Regarding the organization of classes, we recommend that classes follow a similar structure between cohorts. Something that we have noted as mentors is that when talking with mentees, it seems that the class structure has changed since we have taken the class. Although the core values of the HHV minor are always present, it may help give students peace of mind if they knew what to expect of the introduction and the capstone course. Developing a framework that each class follows could still allow for changes from year to year, but the framework would be able to give the class some consistency. The framework could be used by other professors in the future as well. Anonymous student feedback surveys may help Dr. Braitberg to learn more about what students would like to see from the organization and structure of the HHV minor. Although there is a university wide end of semester student course survey, we believe that Dr. Braitberg should have students fill out an anonymous survey that is more specific to the organization and structure of the class. This could provide Dr. Braitberg with more helpful insight into what students would like to see with regards to structure and organization. Change Proposal #4: Increase Inter-Cohort and Alumni Support/Connection The Health and Human values minor has a diverse group of majors, internships, and various opportunities that are available to the community. However, there are rarely settings where these are shared across cohorts. The first time that we were able to share our own opportunities/experiences in depth was as mentors in the 250 course. A potential way to enrich participation in the minor is through events where sharing these opportunities is celebrated and encouraged. Thus, HHV social events one or two every semester, where HHV students in the internship, capstone, and core introductory course are required to attend would start the spread of information about unique opportunities that are available in the healthcare space. Another method to increase the inter-cohort support by other undergraduate mentors would be an HHV preceptorship for the 250 course in the spring. A preceptorship encourages dialogue between more HHV seniors and newer students in the minor. A peer mentor has the advantage of being more approachable, the shared experience of being a student in the course, and could reduce the grading workload for faculty (for smaller assignments like discussion posts). When most people enter their internship, most talk to Dr. Braitberg and the person who previously was in the internship before them, but rarely get the opportunity to see presentations about internships that are available to them. Therefore, there should be a database of posters/recorded presentations that students can watch if they are unable to come to the peer capstone/internship academic poster session. The HHV minor has multiple graduating classes, but there seems to be a lack of alumni support from those that are outside of the minor. Therefore, it is imperative that alumni offer advice and support to students that are trying to find their path through the HHV minor and beyond. There should be a form/spreadsheet with the contact information of graduated HHV students along with a note (if possible) of what their plans were immediately after graduation. This would allow HHV mentors to start connecting with alumni near graduation and could become something that could be advertised to increase the amount of people that apply to HHV. HHV is an Honors minor, but there seems to be a limited connection between it and the remainder of the Honors College. An idea that should be discussed further is offering interdisciplinary approaches to problems by offering collaborative work sessions or seminars between HHV students and other Honors minors.

He recognizes that education is a potent tool in empowering individuals and creating informed citizens who can transform societies. As such, he has been at the forefront of efforts to institute educational reforms that have led to positive outcomes in the country. Mohannad has worked tirelessly with government agencies and educational institutions to identify the most pressing areas of need within the educational system and to develop targeted strategies to address them. One of the primary areas of focus for Mohannad has been improving the quality of teaching. He has introduced various teaching programs to provide teachers with the requisite skills and knowledge to create engaging lesson plans and instill a love of learning in their students. Furthermore, Mohannad has sought to make education more accessible to students throughout Egypt. In this regard, he has supported efforts aimed at expanding the number of schools and improving their infrastructure to ensure that all students have access to quality educational facilities and resources. Additionally, Mohannad has supported initiatives to increase student enrollment by providing financial assistance to families who cannot afford to cover the costs of school fees. text: proof read this: RPG game developer and publisher launched a new RPG game "Super Snail" in the US on 3rd Aug. Confirmed with client that there is no new game launch in Q4 nor market expansion plan for existing pipeline. Base on historical data, client tends to reduce DRR to a extremely low level or stop spending after the game lauch "honeymoon" period. For example, Xiamen Celadon launched a new new in JP in Q2 2022 spent $1.8M at Meta, but the following Q3 they were alomost a $0 spender and the following Q4 only spent $10K. In 2023, rev remained quite low due to only doing game testing campaigns until the game launch in Q3. Furthermore, recent DRR shows that Xiamen Celadon is starting to reduce their spending from the peak DRR at $129K to current below $80K and is expected to keep gradually decreasing to $0. Q4 BU is based on client's Christmas version app campaign media budget plan in December in the US. The scale is expected to be a much smaller one compares to Q3 (25% of the game luanch budget).
